00055 #ifdef TSV_USE_RDBUF

00068 // Chars literials in numeric form (so they arent converted
00069 // by the compiler) should be an enum?
00070 
00071 /// Hex code for TAB char
00072 #define TSV_CHAR_TAB     (0x09)
00073 /// Hex code for LF char
00074 #define TSV_CHAR_LF      (0x0a)
00075 /// Hex code for a COMMA char
00076 #define TSV_CHAR_COMMA   (0x2c)
00077 /// Hex code for CR char
00078 #define TSV_CHAR_CR      (0x0d)
00079 /// Hex code for comment char
00080 #define TSV_CHAR_COMMENT (0x23)
00081 /// Hex code for SPACE char
00082 #define TSV_CHAR_SPACE   (0x20)
00083 /// code for end-of-file signal
00084 #define TSV_CHAR_EOF     (-1)
00085 /// Comment string
00086 #define TSV_STRING_COMMENT  "#"
00087 /// Meta string
00088 #define TSV_STRING_META     "#%"
00089 
00090 /// Unix End-of-line
00091 #define TSV_EOL_UNIX   "\n"
00092 /// Windows End-of-line
00093 #define TSV_EOL_WIN    "\r\n"
00094 
00095 // be nice to less fortunate users...
00096 // use the native line endings
00097 #ifdef WIN32
00098 #define TSV_EOL TSV_EOL_WIN
00099 #else
00100 #define TSV_EOL TSV_EOL_UNIX
00101 #endif

00105 /// @brief     Trim whitespace from the left of a string
00106 /// @param     str       the string to trim
00107 void
00108 affx::ltrim(std::string& str)
00109 {
00110   string::size_type pos=str.find_first_not_of(" \t");
00111   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00112     str.erase();
00113   } else {
00114     str.erase(0,pos);
00115   }
00116 }
00117 
00118 /// @brief     Trim whitespace from the right of a string
00119 /// @param     str       the string to trim
00120 void
00121 affx::rtrim(std::string& str)
00122 {
00123   string::size_type pos=str.find_last_not_of(" \t");
00124   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00125     str.erase();
00126   } else {
00127     str.erase(pos+1);
00128   }
00129 }
00130 
00131 /// @brief     Trim whitespace from both sides of a string
00132 /// @param     str       the string to trim
00133 void
00134 affx::trim(std::string& str)
00135 {
00136   ltrim(str);
00137   rtrim(str);
00138 }

00140 // Turn a string into a lowercase string.
00141 std::string affx::tolower(const string& str)
00142 {
00143   std::string str_lc=str;
00144   for (size_t i=0;i<str_lc.size();i++) {
00145     // call the C function of the same name
00146     str_lc[i]=::tolower(str_lc[i]);
00147   }
00148   return str_lc;
00149 }

00151 /// @brief     Remove quotes from a string if they are matching
00152 /// @param     str       String to remove them from
00153 void
00154 affx::dequote(std::string& str)
00155 {
00156   // we only trim paired quotes
00157   size_t str_size=str.size();
00158   if (str_size<2) {
00159     return;
00160   }
00161   // pick out first and last char
00162   unsigned char c_begin=str[0];
00163   unsigned char c_end=str[str_size-1];
00164   // paired quotes?
00165   if (((c_begin=='"')||(c_begin=='\''))&&(c_begin==c_end)) {
00166     str.erase(str.size()-1,1); // remove last quote
00167     str.erase(0,1);            // remove first quote
00168   }
00169 }
00170 
00171 int
00172 affx::countchars(const std::string& str,char chr)
00173 {
00174   int cnt=0;
00175   for (size_t i=0;i<str.size();i++) {
00176     if (str[i]==chr) {
00177       cnt++;
00178     }
00179   }
00180   return cnt;
00181 }

00183 /// @brief     Split a string into a vector
00184 /// @param     str       string to split
00185 /// @param     c         character to split on
00186 /// @param     vec       vector to fill with split strings
00187 /// @return    number of resulting strings
00188 int
00189 affx::splitstr(const std::string& str,char c,std::vector<std::string>& vec)
00190 {
00191   string::size_type pos1=0;
00192   string::size_type pos2=0;
00193   int num=0;
00194 
00195   vec.clear();
00196 
00197   while (1) {
00198     pos2=str.find(c,pos1);
00199     if (pos2==string::npos) {
00200       vec.resize(num+1);
00201       vec[num].assign(str,pos1,str.size()-pos1);
00202       break;
00203     } else {
00204       vec.resize(num+1);
00205       vec[num].assign(str,pos1,pos2-pos1);
00206       pos1=pos2+1;
00207     }
00208     ++num;
00209   }
00210   return num;
00211 }

00213 /// @brief     Convert the escaped char to the char which it represents
00214 /// @param     c         the escaped char
00215 /// @return    the converted char
00216 int
00217 affx::unescapeChar(int c)
00218 {
00219   switch (c) {
00220   case 'b': return   8 ; // backspace
00221   case 'e': return  27 ; // escape
00222   case 'f': return  12 ; // form feed
00223   case 'n': return  TSV_CHAR_LF ;
00224   case 'r': return  TSV_CHAR_CR ;
00225   case 't': return  TSV_CHAR_TAB;
00226   case 'v': return  11; // vertical tab
00227     // return the character unchanged.
00228   default: return c;
00229   }
00230 }
00231 
00232 int
00233 affx::escapeChar(int c)
00234 {
00235   switch (c) {
00236   case  8:           return   'b' ; // backspace
00237   case 27:           return   'e' ; // escape
00238   case 12:           return   'f' ; // form feed
00239   case TSV_CHAR_LF:  return   'n' ;
00240   case TSV_CHAR_CR:  return   'r' ;
00241   case TSV_CHAR_TAB: return   't' ;
00242   case 11:           return   'v' ; // vertical tab
00243   case '#':          return   '#' ; // comment char
00244     // no escape needed.
00245   default: return 0;
00246   }
00247 }
00248  
00249 std::string
00250 affx::escapeString(const std::string& str,const char eChar)
00251 {
00252   int i_max=str.size();
00253   std::string estring;
00254 
00255   estring.reserve(i_max);
00256 
00257   for (int i=0;i<i_max;i++) {
00258     char c=str[i];
00259     char cc=escapeChar(c);
00260     if (cc!=0) {
00261       estring.append(1,eChar);
00262       estring.append(1,cc);
00263     }
00264     else if (c==eChar) {
00265       estring.append(1,eChar);
00266       estring.append(1,c);
00267     }
00268     else {
00269       estring.append(1,c);
00270     }
00271   }
00272   
00273   return estring;
00274 }

00312 std::string
00313 TsvFileBinding::get_type_str()
00314 {
00315   if (m_ptr_int!=NULL) {
00316     return "int";
00317   }
00318   if (m_ptr_string!=NULL) {
00319     return "string";
00320   }
00321   if (m_ptr_float!=NULL) {
00322     return "float";
00323   }
00324   if (m_ptr_double!=NULL) {
00325     return "double";
00326   }
00327   if (m_ptr_uint!=NULL) {
00328     return "uint";
00329   }
00330   if (m_ptr_ulonglong!=NULL) {
00331     return "longlong";
00332   }
00333   //
00334   return "unbound";
00335 }

00370 /// @brief     Clear the values of this feild.
00371 void
00372 affx::TsvFileField::clear()
00373 {
00374   m_buffer="";
00375   m_isnull=true;
00376   //
00377   m_val_state=affx::VALSTATE_STRING;
00378   //
00379   m_value_int=0;
00380   m_value_int_done=false;
00381   m_value_int_rv=0;
00382   m_value_double=0.0;
00383   m_value_double_done=false;
00384   m_value_double_rv=0;
00385   m_value_uint=0;
00386   m_value_uint_done=false;
00387   m_value_uint_rv=0;
00388   m_value_ulonglong=0;
00389   m_value_ulonglong_done=false;
00390   m_value_ulonglong_rv=0;
00391   // default is 6 places "0.000000"
00392   m_precision=TSV_DEFAULT_PRECISION;
00393 }

00438 /// @brief     Set the buffer value of the column
00439 /// @param     str       The new value
00440 int
00441 affx::TsvFileField::setBuffer(const std::string& str)
00442 {
00443   // dont alias the buffer. "m_buffer=str;" might leave m_buffer as a reference
00444   m_buffer.erase();
00445   m_buffer.append(str.begin(),str.end());
00446   //
00447   m_val_state=affx::VALSTATE_STRING;
00448   //
00449   m_isnull=false;
00450   m_value_int_done=false;
00451   m_value_double_done=false;
00452   m_value_uint_done=false;
00453   m_value_ulonglong_done=false;
00454   return TSV_OK;
00455 }

00461   return TSV_OK;

00463 
00464 void
00465 affx::TsvFileField::convertToString()
00466 {
00467   switch (m_val_state) {
00468   case affx::VALSTATE_NONE:
00469     m_buffer.clear();
00470   case affx::VALSTATE_STRING:
00471     // do nothing; already a string
00472     break;
00473   case affx::VALSTATE_INT:
00474     {
00475       std::ostringstream stream;
00476       stream << m_value_int;
00477       setBuffer(stream.str());
00478     }
00479     break;
00480   case affx::VALSTATE_DOUBLE:
00481     {
00482       std::ostringstream stream;
00483       stream.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
00484       stream.precision(m_precision);
00485       stream << m_value_double;
00486       setBuffer(stream.str());
00487     }
00488     break;
00489   default:
00490     TSV_ERR_ABORT("TsvFileField::convertToString(): internal error. m_val_state="+ToStr(m_val_state));
00491     break;
00492   }
00493 }
00494 
00495 /// handy macro for code.
00496 #define TSV_NULL_RETURN(RV)  if (m_isnull) { *val=RV; return TSV_ERR_NULL; }
00497 
00498 /// @brief     Get the value as a string
00499 /// @param     val       val to set
00500 /// @return    tsv_error_t
00501 int
00502 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::string* val)
00503 {
00504   TSV_NULL_RETURN("");
00505   //
00506   if (m_val_state!=affx::VALSTATE_STRING) {
00507     // we need the string version, convert it...
00508     convertToString();
00509   }
00510   // Avoid data sharing by clearing then appending the contents.
00511   val->erase();
00512   val->append(m_buffer.begin(),m_buffer.end());
00513   return TSV_OK;
00514 }
00515 
00516 /// @brief     Get the value as an int
00517 /// @param     val       val to set
00518 /// @return    tsv_error_t
00519 int
00520 affx::TsvFileField::get(short* val)
00521 {
00522   int tmp_val;
00523   int rv;
00524 
00525   // reset the val.
00526   *val=-1;
00527 
00528   //
00529   rv=get(&tmp_val);
00530   if (rv!=TSV_OK) {
00531     return rv;
00532   }
00533     
00534   if ((tmp_val<-32767)||(tmp_val>32767)) {
00535     return TSV_ERR_CONVERSION;
00536   }
00537   *val=tmp_val;
00538   return TSV_OK;
00539 }
00540 
00541 /// @brief     Get the value as an int
00542 /// @param     val       val to set
00543 /// @return    tsv_error_t
00544 int
00545 affx::TsvFileField::get(int* val)
00546 {
00547   TSV_NULL_RETURN(0);
00548   // done already?
00549   if (m_value_int_done) {
00550     *val=m_value_int;
00551     return m_value_int_rv;
00552   }
00553   //
00554   const char* ptr_start=m_buffer.c_str();
00555   char* ptr_end=NULL;
00556 
00557   /// @todo: "" should be an error?
00558 
00559   // do the conversion (Force base 10)
00560   m_value_int=strtol(ptr_start,&ptr_end,10);
00561   // If m_ptr_end is not NULL then there was an invalid character.
00562   // If m_ptr_end == m_ptr_start then it was the null string. ("")
00563   if ((*ptr_end!=0)||(ptr_end==ptr_start)) {
00564     m_value_int=-1; // fill in with something off the end
00565     m_value_int_rv=TSV_ERR_CONVERSION; // signal an error
00566   }
00567   else {
00568     m_value_int_rv=TSV_OK;
00569   }
00570 
00571   m_value_int_done=true;
00572   *val=m_value_int;
00573   return m_value_int_rv;
00574 }
00575 
00576 /// @brief     Get the value as a double
00577 /// @param     val       val to set
00578 /// @return    tsv_error_t
00579 int
00580 affx::TsvFileField::get(double* val)
00581 {
00582   TSV_NULL_RETURN(0.0);
00583   // done already?
00584   if (m_value_double_done) {
00585     *val=m_value_double;
00586     return m_value_double_rv;
00587   }
00588   //
00589   const char* ptr_start=m_buffer.c_str();
00590   char* ptr_end=NULL;
00591 
00592   // do the conversion
00593   m_value_double=strtod(ptr_start,&ptr_end);
00594   // same checks as strtol
00595   if ((*ptr_end!=0)||(ptr_end==ptr_start)) {
00596     m_value_double=-1.0; // bad value
00597     m_value_double_rv=TSV_ERR_CONVERSION; // signal an error
00598   } else {
00599     m_value_double_rv=TSV_OK;
00600   }
00601 
00602   m_value_double_done=true;
00603   *val=m_value_double;
00604   return m_value_double_rv;
00605 }
00606 
00607 /// @brief     Get the value as a float
00608 /// @param     val       val to set
00609 /// @return    tsv_error_t
00610 int
00611 affx::TsvFileField::get(float* val)
00612 {
00613   if (m_value_double_done) {
00614     *val=(float)m_value_double;
00615     return m_value_double_rv;
00616   }
00617   // Get the double value and cast it.
00618   double tmp_double;
00619   int rv;
00620   rv=get(&tmp_double);
00621   *val=(float)tmp_double;
00622   return rv;
00623 }
00624 
00625 /// @brief     Get the value as an unsigned int
00626 /// @param     val       val to set
00627 /// @return    tsv_error_t
00628 int
00629 affx::TsvFileField::get(unsigned int* val)
00630 {
00631   TSV_NULL_RETURN(0);
00632   // done already?
00633   if (m_value_uint_done) {
00634     *val=m_value_uint;
00635     return m_value_uint_rv;
00636   }
00637   //
00638   const char* m_ptr_start=m_buffer.c_str();
00639   char* m_ptr_end=NULL;
00640 
00641   // do the conversion
00642   m_value_uint=strtoul(m_ptr_start,&m_ptr_end,10);
00643   if ((*m_ptr_end)!=0) {
00644     m_value_uint=0; // fill in zero on error.
00645     m_value_uint_rv=TSV_ERR_CONVERSION; // signal it.
00646   } else {
00647     m_value_uint_rv=TSV_OK;
00648   }
00649 
00650   m_value_uint_done=true;
00651   *val=m_value_uint;
00652   return m_value_uint_rv;
00653 }
00654 
00655 /// @brief     Get the value as an uint64_t
00656 /// @param     val       val to set
00657 /// @return    tsv_error_t
00658 int
00659 affx::TsvFileField::get(uint64_t* val)
00660 {
00661   TSV_NULL_RETURN(0);
00662   // done already?
00663   if (m_value_ulonglong_done) {
00664     *val=m_value_ulonglong;
00665     return m_value_ulonglong_rv;
00666   }
00667   //
00668   const char* m_ptr_start=m_buffer.c_str();
00669   char* m_ptr_end=NULL;
00670 
00671   // do the conversion
00672 #ifndef WIN32
00673   m_value_ulonglong=strtoull(m_ptr_start,&m_ptr_end,10);
00674 #else
00675   m_value_ulonglong=_strtoui64(m_ptr_start,&m_ptr_end,10);
00676 #endif
00677   if ((*m_ptr_end)!=0) {
00678     m_value_ulonglong=0; // fill in zero on error.
00679     m_value_ulonglong_rv=TSV_ERR_CONVERSION; // signal it.
00680   } else {
00681     m_value_ulonglong_rv=TSV_OK;
00682   }
00683 
00684   m_value_ulonglong_done=true;
00685   *val=m_value_ulonglong;
00686   return m_value_ulonglong_rv;
00687 }

00691 #define TSV_SPLIT_VEC_BODY(TYPE)                  \
00692   int rv=affx::TSV_OK;                            \
00693   string::size_type pos1;                         \
00694   string::size_type pos2;                         \
00695   char* pos_out;                                  \
00696   TYPE val;                                       \
00697                                                   \
00698   vec->clear();                                   \
00699                                                   \
00700   if (m_buffer=="") {                             \
00701     return rv;                                    \
00702   }                                               \
00703                                                   \
00704   pos1=0;                                         \
00705   while (1) {                                     \
00706     pos2=m_buffer.find(sep,pos1);                 \
00707     if (pos2==string::npos) {                     \
00708       val=CONVERT_FUNC();                         \
00709       vec->push_back(val);                        \
00710       break;                                      \
00711     } else {                                      \
00712       val=CONVERT_FUNC();                         \
00713       vec->push_back(val);                        \
00714       pos1=pos2+1;                                \
00715     }                                             \
00716   }                                               \
00717   return rv;
00718 
00719 int
00720 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::vector<int>* vec,char sep)
00721 {
00722 #define CONVERT_FUNC() strtol(&m_buffer[pos1],&pos_out,10)
00723   TSV_SPLIT_VEC_BODY(int);
00724 #undef CONVERT_FUNC
00725 }
00726 int
00727 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::vector<float>* vec,char sep)
00728 {
00729 #define CONVERT_FUNC() (float)strtod(&m_buffer[pos1],&pos_out)
00730   TSV_SPLIT_VEC_BODY(float);
00731 #undef CONVERT_FUNC
00732 }
00733 int
00734 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::vector<double>* vec,char sep)
00735 {
00736 #define CONVERT_FUNC() strtod(&m_buffer[pos1],&pos_out)
00737   TSV_SPLIT_VEC_BODY(double);
00738 #undef CONVERT_FUNC
00739 }
00740 
00741 int
00742 affx::TsvFileField::get(std::vector<std::string>* vec,char sep)
00743 {
00744   int rv=affx::TSV_OK;
00745   string::size_type pos1;
00746   string::size_type pos2;
00747   std::string val;
00748 
00749   vec->clear();
00750 
00751   if (m_buffer=="") {
00752     return rv;
00753   }
00754 
00755   pos1=0;
00756   while (1) {
00757     pos2=m_buffer.find(sep,pos1);
00758     if (pos2==string::npos) {
00759       val.assign(m_buffer,pos1,m_buffer.size()-pos1);
00760       vec->push_back(val);
00761       break;
00762     } else {
00763       val.assign(m_buffer,pos1,pos2-pos1);
00764       vec->push_back(val);
00765       pos1=pos2+1;
00766     }
00767   }
00768 
00769   return rv;
00770 }
00771 
00772 //////////
00773 
00774 #define TSV_CONCAT_VEC_BODY() {                 \
00775   if (vec.size()>0) {                           \
00776     stream << vec[0];                           \
00777     for (size_t i=1;i<vec.size();i++) {         \
00778       stream << sep << vec[i];                  \
00779     }                                           \
00780   }                                             \
00781   setBuffer(stream.str());                      \
00782   return TSV_OK;                                \
00783   }
00784 
00785 int
00786 affx::TsvFileField::set(const std::vector<std::string>& vec,char sep)
00787 {
00788   std::ostringstream stream;
00789   TSV_CONCAT_VEC_BODY();
00790 }
00791 int
00792 affx::TsvFileField::set(const std::vector<int>& vec,char sep)
00793 {
00794   std::ostringstream stream;
00795   TSV_CONCAT_VEC_BODY();
00796 }
00797 int
00798 affx::TsvFileField::set(const std::vector<float>& vec,char sep)
00799 {
00800   std::ostringstream stream;
00801   stream.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
00802   stream.precision(m_precision);
00803   TSV_CONCAT_VEC_BODY();
00804 }
00805 int
00806 affx::TsvFileField::set(const std::vector<double>& vec,char sep)
00807 {
00808   std::ostringstream stream;
00809   stream.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
00810   stream.precision(m_precision);
00811   TSV_CONCAT_VEC_BODY();
00812 }
00813 
00814 #undef TSV_CONCAT_VEC_BODY
00815

00842   stream.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);   \
00843   stream.precision(m_precision);              \
00844   stream << val;                              \

00903 //////////
00904 
00905 /// @brief     Add the var to the collection of linked vars
00906 /// @param     var       var to add
00907 void
00908 affx::TsvFileField::linkedvar_push(affx::TsvFileBinding* var)
00909 {
00910   m_linkedvar_vec.push_back(var);
00911 }
00912 /// @brief     Clear the linkages to bound variables.
00913 void
00914 affx::TsvFileField::linkedvars_clear()
00915 {
00916   m_linkedvar_vec.clear();
00917 }
00918 /// @brief     Assign each linked var a value.
00919 void
00920 affx::TsvFileField::linkedvars_assign(affx::TsvFile* tsvfile)
00921 {
00922   // Assign to the linked vars
00923   size_t lvar_vec_size=m_linkedvar_vec.size();
00924   int rv=TSV_OK;
00925 
00926   for (size_t vi=0;vi<lvar_vec_size;vi++) {
00927     TsvFileBinding* var=m_linkedvar_vec[vi];
00928     if (var!=NULL) {
00929       // These are sorted by frequency of use.
00930       if (var->m_ptr_int!=NULL) {
00931         rv=get(var->m_ptr_int);
00932       }
00933       else if (var->m_ptr_string!=NULL) {
00934         rv=get(var->m_ptr_string);
00935       }
00936       else if (var->m_ptr_float!=NULL) {
00937         rv=get(var->m_ptr_float);
00938       }
00939       else if (var->m_ptr_double!=NULL) {
00940         rv=get(var->m_ptr_double);
00941       }
00942       else if (var->m_ptr_uint!=NULL) {
00943         rv=get(var->m_ptr_uint);
00944       }
00945       else if (var->m_ptr_ulonglong!=NULL) {
00946         rv=get(var->m_ptr_ulonglong);
00947       }
00948       else {
00949         TSV_ERR_ABORT("internal error: Binding does not have a pointer!");
00950       }
00951       //
00952       if ((rv!=TSV_OK)&&(var->m_flags&TSV_BIND_REQUIRED)) {
00953         // We say "data line" to make it clear we arent counting header lines.
00954         std::string errmsg="Conversion error\n";
00955         errmsg+="TSVERROR: '"+tsvfile->m_fileName+"':"+ToStr(tsvfile->lineNumber()+1)+": ";
00956         errmsg+="Conversion of required field '"+m_cname+"'"+
00957           " to "+var->get_type_str()+
00958           " of '"+m_buffer+"' failed!\n";
00959         TSV_ERR_ABORT(errmsg);
00960       }
00961     }
00962   }
00963 }
00964 
00965 std::string
00966 affx::TsvFileField::get_bound_types_str()
00967 {
00968   std::string rv="";
00969   size_t lvar_vec_size=m_linkedvar_vec.size();
00970 
00971   for (size_t vi=0;vi<lvar_vec_size;vi++) {
00972     TsvFileBinding* var=m_linkedvar_vec[vi];
00973     if (var!=NULL) {
00974       // These are sorted by frequency of use.
00975       if (var->m_ptr_int!=NULL) {
00976         rv+="int,";
00977       }
00978       else if (var->m_ptr_string!=NULL) {
00979         rv+="string,";
00980       }
00981       else if (var->m_ptr_float!=NULL) {
00982         rv+="float,";
00983       }
00984       else if (var->m_ptr_double!=NULL) {
00985         rv+="double,";
00986       }
00987       else if (var->m_ptr_uint!=NULL) {
00988         rv+="uint,";
00989       }
00990       else if (var->m_ptr_ulonglong!=NULL) {
00991         rv+="longlong,";
00992       }
00993     }
00994   }
00995   // trim trailing ","
00996   if (rv!="") {
00997     rv.erase(rv.size()-1);
00998   }
00999   return rv;
01000 }
01001 
01002 /* Unused -- code which wants this generally uses <std::map>
01003 int
01004 affx::TsvFileField::setInternCacheSize(int size)
01005 {
01006   int old_size=m_interncache_size;
01007   // -1 means ignore this setting.
01008   if (size==TSV_INTERNSIZE_UNSET) {
01009     return old_size;
01010   }
01011   // Zero disables it, positive size enables it
01012   m_interncache_size=size;
01013   m_interncache_vec.reserve(size);
01014   if (size<(int)m_interncache_vec.size()) {
01015     // this is not random replacement but is quick.
01016     m_interncache_vec.resize(size);
01017   }
01018   //
01019   return old_size;
01020 }
01021 */

01025 /// @brief Create a TsvFileIndex
01026 affx::TsvFileIndex::TsvFileIndex()
01027 {
01028   init();
01029 }
01030 /// @brief Destroy a TsvFileIndex
01031 affx::TsvFileIndex::~TsvFileIndex()
01032 {
01033 }
01034 
01035 /// @brief     Init the member vars to known values
01036 void
01037 affx::TsvFileIndex::init()
01038 {
01039   m_bindto_cidx=-1;
01040   m_bindto_clvl=-1;
01041   m_bindto_cname="";
01042   m_bindto_type=TSV_BINDTO_NONE;
01043   m_flags=0;
01044   m_kind=0;
01045   //
01046   clear();
01047 }
01048 
01049 /// @brief     Clear the contents of the index
01050 void
01051 affx::TsvFileIndex::clear()
01052 {
01053   m_done=false;
01054   m_index_str2line.clear();
01055   m_index_int2line.clear();
01056   m_index_double2line.clear();
01057   m_index_uint2line.clear();
01058   m_index_ulonglong2line.clear();
01059 }
01060 
01061 /// @brief     Add the data from field to the index
01062 /// @param     field     The field to index
01063 /// @param     line      The line number on which it was found
01064 void
01065 affx::TsvFileIndex::data_add(TsvFileField* field,linenum_t line)
01066 {
01067   APT_ERR_ASSERT(field!=NULL,"internal error: data_add: field is null.");
01068   //
01069   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_STRING) {
01070     // WARNING: field->m_buffer is reused and will be overwritten.
01071     // So we need to force a fresh copy to be made by modifying the string.
01072     // so first we "copy" the string.
01073     // std::string str_copy=field->m_buffer;
01074     // then we modify it -- this forces a copy
01075     // str_copy.append(1,' ');
01076     // then we undo the modification
01077     // str_copy.resize(str_copy.size()-1);
01078     // now we can use it in our map
01079     std::string str_copy;
01080     str_copy.append(field->m_buffer.begin(),field->m_buffer.end());
01081     m_index_str2line.insert(make_pair(str_copy,line));
01082     return;
01083   }
01084   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_INT) {
01085     int tmp_int;
01086     if (field->get(&tmp_int)==TSV_OK) {
01087       m_index_int2line.insert(make_pair(tmp_int,line));
01088     }
01089     return;
01090   }
01091   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_DOUBLE) {
01092     double tmp_double;
01093     if (field->get(&tmp_double)==TSV_OK) {
01094       m_index_double2line.insert(make_pair(tmp_double,line));
01095     }
01096     return;
01097   }
01098   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_UINT) {
01099     unsigned int tmp_uint;
01100     if (field->get(&tmp_uint)==TSV_OK) {
01101       m_index_uint2line.insert(make_pair(tmp_uint,line));
01102     }
01103     return;
01104   }
01105   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_ULONGLONG) {
01106     uint64_t tmp_ulonglong;
01107     if (field->get(&tmp_ulonglong)==TSV_OK) {
01108       m_index_ulonglong2line.insert(make_pair(tmp_ulonglong,line));
01109     }
01110     return;
01111   }
01112 }
01113 
01114 /// @brief     Template to query an index for matching values
01115 /// @param     results   Where to stick the line numbers
01116 /// @param     T1        Datatype of the maps
01117 /// @param     map       map to search
01118 /// @param     op        comparison operator
01119 /// @param     val       value to compare against
01120 /// @return    tsv_return_t
01121 template<typename T1, typename linenum_t>
01122 int
01123 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append_tmpl(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,
01124                                      std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>& mmap,
01125                                      int op,
01126                                      T1& val)
01127 {
01128   typename std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>::iterator r_start,r_end;
01129 
01130   if (op==TSV_OP_LT) {
01131     r_start=mmap.begin();
01132     r_end=mmap.lower_bound(val);
01133   }
01134   else if (op==TSV_OP_LTEQ) {
01135     r_start=mmap.begin();
01136     r_end=mmap.upper_bound(val);
01137   }
01138   else if (op==TSV_OP_EQ) {
01139     r_start=mmap.lower_bound(val);
01140     r_end=mmap.upper_bound(val);
01141   }
01142   else if (op==TSV_OP_GTEQ) {
01143     r_start=mmap.lower_bound(val);
01144     r_end=mmap.end();
01145   }
01146   else if (op==TSV_OP_GT) {
01147     r_start=mmap.upper_bound(val);
01148     r_end=mmap.end();
01149   } else {
01150     TSV_ERR_ABORT("Invalid operation in results_append. op="+ToStr(op));
01151     return TSV_ERR_UNKNOWN;
01152   }
01153 
01154   // Stick the range into find_result
01155   while (r_start!=r_end) {
01156     //printf("r_start=(%4d,%4d)\n",(*r_start).first,(int)(*r_start).second);
01157     results.push_back((*r_start).second);
01158     r_start++;
01159   }
01160   //
01161   return TSV_OK;;
01162 }
01163 
01164 /// @brief     Append the matching string results to the vec
01165 /// @param     results   where to append
01166 /// @param     op        comparison to do
01167 /// @param     val       value to compare to
01168 /// @return    tsv_return_t
01169 int
01170 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,std::string val)
01171 {
01172   // Use the template for the different types
01173   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_str2line,op,val);
01174 }
01175 /// @brief     Append the matching string results to the vec
01176 /// @param     results   where to append
01177 /// @param     op        comparison to do
01178 /// @param     val       value to compare to
01179 /// @return    tsv_return_t
01180 int
01181 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,int val)
01182 {
01183   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_int2line,op,val);
01184 }
01185 /// @brief     Append the matching string results to the vec
01186 /// @param     results   where to append
01187 /// @param     op        comparison to do
01188 /// @param     val       value to compare to
01189 /// @return    tsv_return_t
01190 int
01191 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,double val)
01192 {
01193   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_double2line,op,val);
01194 }
01195 /// @brief     Append the matching string results to the vec
01196 /// @param     results   where to append
01197 /// @param     op        comparison to do
01198 /// @param     val       value to compare to
01199 /// @return    tsv_return_t
01200 int
01201 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,unsigned int val)
01202 {
01203   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_uint2line,op,val);
01204 }
01205 /// @brief     Append the matching string results to the vec
01206 /// @param     results   where to append
01207 /// @param     op        comparison to do
01208 /// @param     val       value to compare to
01209 /// @return    tsv_return_t
01210 int
01211 affx::TsvFileIndex::results_append(std::vector<linenum_t>& results,int op,uint64_t val)
01212 {
01213   return results_append_tmpl(results,m_index_ulonglong2line,op,val);
01214 }
01215 
01216 /// @brief     Dump the contents of an index
01217 /// @param     T1        Datatype of the maps key
01218 /// @param     map       the map to dump
01219 template<typename T1, typename linenum_t>
01220 void
01221 affx::TsvFileIndex::dump_map(std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>& mmap)
01222 {
01223   typename std::multimap<T1,linenum_t>::iterator i;
01224   int cnt=0;
01225   for (i=mmap.begin();i!=mmap.end();i++) {
01226     cout << cnt++ << " : '" << (*i).first << "' : '" << (*i).second << "'\n";
01227   }
01228 }
01229 
01230 /// @brief     Dump the contents of the index
01231 void
01232 affx::TsvFileIndex::dump()
01233 {
01234   printf("index (clvl=%2d,cidx=%2d,kind=%2d) ==========\n",m_bindto_clvl,m_bindto_cidx,m_kind);
01235 
01236   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_STRING) {
01237     dump_map(m_index_str2line);
01238   }
01239   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_INT) {
01240     dump_map(m_index_int2line);
01241   }
01242   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_DOUBLE) {
01243     dump_map(m_index_double2line);
01244   }
01245   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_UINT) {
01246     dump_map(m_index_uint2line);
01247   }
01248   if (m_kind==TSV_INDEX_ULONGLONG) {
01249     dump_map(m_index_ulonglong2line);
01250   }
01251 }

01255 /// @brief   Init the slots of the object.
01256 affx::TsvFileHeaderLine::TsvFileHeaderLine()
01257 {
01258   m_key="";
01259   m_value="";
01260   m_order=0;
01261 }
01262 
01263 /// @brief  Init the slots to the values given.
01264 affx::TsvFileHeaderLine::TsvFileHeaderLine(const std::string& key,const std::string& value,int order)
01265 {
01266   m_key=key;
01267   m_value=value;
01268   m_order=order;
01269 }
01270 
01271 /// @brief  Less than operator for comparing TsvFileHeaderLines
01272 bool
01273 affx::TsvFileHeaderLine::operator<(const affx::TsvFileHeaderLine& b) const
01274 {
01275   if (m_order==b.m_order) {
01276     return (m_key<b.m_key);
01277   }
01278   return (m_order<b.m_order);
01279 }
01280 
01281 void
01282 affx::TsvFileHeaderLine::print()
01283 {
01284   if (m_key=="") {
01285     printf("#%s\n",m_value.c_str());
01286   }
01287   else {
01288     printf("#%%%s=%s\n",m_key.c_str(),m_value.c_str());
01289   }
01290 }
01291 
01292 
01293 /// @brief  Function for comparing TsvFileHeaderLine pointers
01294 bool
01295 affx::header_ptr_less(const affx::TsvFileHeaderLine* a,const affx::TsvFileHeaderLine* b)
01296 {
01297   // sort nulls to the end
01298   if ((a==NULL)&&(b==NULL)) {
01299     return false;
01300   }
01301   if (b==NULL) {
01302     return true;
01303   }
01304   if (a==NULL) {
01305     return false;
01306   }
01307 
01308   return ((*a)<(*b));
01309 }

01339 /// @return    lvalue
01340 affx::TsvFile::~TsvFile()
01341 {

01345 
01346 /// @brief     set options to their defaults
01347 void
01348 affx::TsvFile::default_options()
01349 {
01350   m_rawOpen = false;
01351   m_optAllowDataComment=true;
01352   m_optAbortOnError=true;
01353   m_optAutoColumns=false;
01354   m_optAutoDequote=true;
01355   m_optAutoIndex=true;
01356   m_optAutoSenseSep=true;
01357   m_optAutoTrim=false;
01358   m_optCheckFormatOnOpen=true;
01359   //m_optCommentChar='#';
01360   m_optDoQuote=false;
01361   // This seems to be a common use case. - jhg
01362   // If you really care, then call tsv->setEscapeOk(whatEverYouWant)
01363   // #ifdef WIN32
01364   //   m_optEscapeOk=false;
01365   // #else
01366   m_optEscapeOk=true;
01367   // #endif
01368   m_optEscapeChar='\\';
01369   m_optQuoteChar1='\'';
01370   m_optQuoteChar2='"';
01371   m_optFieldSep=TSV_CHAR_TAB;
01372   m_optHasColumnHeader=true;
01373   m_optQuoteChar='"';
01374   m_optThrowOnError=false;
01375   m_optEndl=TSV_EOL;
01376   m_optLinkVarsOnOpen = true;
01377   m_headName = "header";
01378   m_optPrecision=-1;
01379 }
01380

01383 void
01384 affx::TsvFile::setAbortOnError(bool value)
01385 {
01386   m_optAbortOnError=value;
01387 }

01424 /// @brief init a new TsvFile.
01425 void
01426 affx::TsvFile::init()
01427 {
01428 #ifdef TSV_USER_RDBUF
01429   m_rdbuf=NULL;
01430 #endif
01431   m_headers_curptr=NULL;
01432 }
01433 
01434 /// @brief     clear all the resources of a TsvFile.
01435 void
01436 affx::TsvFile::clear()
01437 {
01438   // close the file before zapping everything...
01439   close();
01440   // ...zap the filename
01441   m_fileName.clear();
01442 
01443   // dispose of all the bindings.
01444   clearBindings();
01445   // and the indexes
01446   clearIndexes();
01447   // and the headers
01448   clearHeaders();
01449   // and the column headers
01450   clearColumnHeaders();
01451   
01452   //
01453   m_lineLvl=0;
01454   m_lineNum=0;
01455   m_eof=false;
01456   m_index_done=false;
01457 }
01458 
01459 /// @brief Clear the bindings of columns to variables.
01460 void
01461 affx::TsvFile::clearBindings()
01462 {
01463   // clear the linked vars in the columns
01464   linkvars_clear();
01465   // release the memory of the vars
01466   for (unsigned int vi=0;vi<m_linkvars_vec.size();vi++) {
01467     delete m_linkvars_vec[vi];
01468   }
01469   // forget the pointers
01470   m_linkvars_vec.clear();
01471   // done because there arent any.
01472   m_linkvars_done=true;
01473 }
01474 
01475 /// @brief     Clear (ie delete) all the indexes
01476 void
01477 affx::TsvFile::clearIndexes()
01478 {
01479   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_index_vec.size();i++) {
01480     if (m_index_vec[i]!=NULL) {
01481       m_index_vec[i]->clear();
01482       delete m_index_vec[i];
01483     }
01484   }
01485 }
01486 
01487 /// @brief     Clear all the fields.  (set them all to null)
01488 void
01489 affx::TsvFile::clearFields()
01490 {
01491   clearFieldsBelowClvl(0);
01492 }
01493 
01494 /// @brief     Clear the columns at greater indents
01495 /// @param     clvl_start  Clear fields at or larger than this level.
01496 void
01497 affx::TsvFile::clearFieldsBelowClvl(int clvl_start)
01498 {
01499   assert(clvl_start>=0);
01500 
01501   unsigned int clvl_size=m_column_map.size();
01502   for (unsigned int clvl=clvl_start;clvl<clvl_size;clvl++) {
01503     unsigned int cidx_size=m_column_map[clvl].size();
01504     for (unsigned int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_size;cidx++) {
01505       m_column_map[clvl][cidx].clear();
01506       // dont zero out the linked vars -- while they should be zeroed,
01507       // it takes time.
01508       // m_column_map[clvl][cidx].linkedvars_assign();
01509     }
01510   }
01511 }

01519 affx::TsvFile::setError(int err)
01520 {
01521   //
01522   m_errno=err;
01523   if (m_errno==TSV_OK) {
01524     return m_errno;
01525   }
01526 
01527   //
01528   if (m_optAbortOnError==true) {
01529     assert(0);
01530   }
01531   //
01532   return err;
01533 }

01541 }

01561 /// @brief     The number of levels defined
01562 /// @return    clvl
01563 int
01564 affx::TsvFile::getLevelCount()
01565 {
01566   return (int)m_column_map.size();
01567 }
01568 /// @brief     The number of columns for this level
01569 /// @param     clvl      the level we are asking about
01570 /// @return    cidx
01571 int
01572 affx::TsvFile::getColumnCount(int clvl)
01573 {
01574   if ((clvl>=0)&&(clvl<(int)m_column_map.size())) {
01575     return (int)m_column_map[clvl].size();
01576   }
01577   return 0;
01578 }
01579 
01580 /// @brief     Are we looking at the end of a line?
01581 /// @return    true if at end of line.
01582 bool
01583 affx::TsvFile::f_lookingat_eol()
01584 {
01585   int c;
01586   // the end of a file is the end of a line.
01587   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
01588     return true;
01589   }
01590   //
01591   //c=m_fileStream.peek();
01592   c=M_PEEK();
01593   if (c==EOF) {
01594     return true;
01595   }
01596   if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)) {
01597     return true;
01598   }
01599   return false;
01600 }
01601 
01602 /// @brief     Read a line from a TsvFile into a string.
01603 /// @param     line    A buffer to modify
01604 /// @return    tsv_return_t
01605 /// @remarks   Lines end with (0x0a "\n") (0x0d "\r") or (0x0d 0x0a "\r\n")
01606 int
01607 affx::TsvFile::f_getline(std::string& line)
01608 {
01609   int c;
01610 
01611   line.clear();
01612   // we have some sort of error
01613   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
01614     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
01615   }
01616 
01617   while (1) {
01618     // get a char...
01619     //c=m_fileStream.get();
01620     c=M_GETC();
01621     // eof?
01622     if ((c==TSV_CHAR_EOF)||!m_fileStream.good()) {
01623       break;
01624     }
01625     // LF ends a line
01626     if (c==TSV_CHAR_LF) {
01627       break;
01628     }
01629     // CR ends a line too.
01630     if (c==TSV_CHAR_CR) {
01631       // c=m_fileStream.peek();
01632       c=M_PEEK();
01633       // CR could be followed by a LF
01634       if (c==TSV_CHAR_LF) {
01635         //c=m_fileStream.get();
01636         c=M_GETC();
01637         break;
01638       }
01639     }
01640     // push it on
01641     line.append(1,(char)c);
01642   }
01643   //
01644   return TSV_OK;
01645 }
01646 
01647 
01648 
01649 //////////
01650 
01651 /// @brief     clear all the headers.
01652 void
01653 affx::TsvFile::clearHeaders()
01654 {
01655   m_headers_bykey.clear();
01656   //
01657   int v_size=(int)m_headers_vec.size();
01658   for (int vi=0;vi<v_size;vi++) {
01659     delete m_headers_vec[vi];
01660     m_headers_vec[vi]=NULL;
01661   }
01662   //
01663   m_headers_vec.clear();
01664   m_headers_vec_packed=true;
01665   // clear these too...
01666   headersBegin();
01667 }
01668 
01669 /// @brief     clear all the column headers.
01670 void
01671 affx::TsvFile::clearColumnHeaders()
01672 {
01673 
01674   // now get rid of the column info.
01675   m_column_map.clear();
01676   m_cnametocidx_map.clear();
01677 
01678 }
01679 
01680 /// @brief     Start at the beginning of the headers
01681 /// @remarks   This acts as the begin for all the ways of walking the headers.
01682 void
01683 affx::TsvFile::headersBegin()
01684 {
01685   resortHeaders();
01686   m_headers_idx=0;
01687   m_headers_iter=m_headers_bykey.begin();
01688   m_headers_curptr=NULL;
01689   m_headers_curkey_string="";
01690 }
01691 
01692 /// @brief Return the next non-null header pointer.  NULL when at or past the end
01693 TsvFileHeaderLine*
01694 affx::TsvFile::nextHeaderPtr()
01695 {
01696   while (m_headers_idx<(int)m_headers_vec.size()) {
01697     m_headers_curptr=m_headers_vec[m_headers_idx++];
01698     if (m_headers_curptr!=NULL) {
01699       return m_headers_curptr;
01700     }
01701   }
01702   m_headers_curptr=NULL;
01703   return m_headers_curptr;
01704 }
01705 
01706 /// @brief     Advance to the next header matching key
01707 /// @param     key       key of the header
01708 /// @param     val       value of the header matched
01709 /// @return
01710 int
01711 affx::TsvFile::headersFindNext(const std::string& key,std::string& val)
01712 {
01713   // if the key is different that the last, do an implicit begin
01714   if (key!=m_headers_curkey_string) {
01715     headersBegin();
01716     m_headers_curkey_string=key;
01717     m_headers_iter=m_headers_bykey.lower_bound(key);
01718   }
01719 
01720   // past the end of matching keys?
01721   if ((m_headers_iter==m_headers_bykey.end())||(m_headers_iter->first!=key)) {
01722     return TSV_HEADER_LAST;
01723   }
01724 
01725   // what we are returning...
01726   val=m_headers_iter->second->m_value;
01727   // point to the next one...
01728   m_headers_iter++;
01729   return TSV_OK;
01730 }
01731 
01732 /// @brief     Advance to the next header of the file and set the values
01733 /// @param     key       key of the header
01734 /// @param     val       value of the header
01735 /// @return
01736 int
01737 affx::TsvFile::headersNext(std::string& key,std::string& val)
01738 {
01739   // skip comment headers
01740   do {
01741     nextHeaderPtr();
01742     if (m_headers_curptr==NULL) {
01743       return TSV_HEADER_LAST;
01744     }
01745   } while (m_headers_curptr->m_key=="");
01746 
01747   key=m_headers_curptr->m_key;
01748   val=m_headers_curptr->m_value;
01749 
01750   // headers next should never return an empty key.
01751   assert(key!="");
01752 
01753   return TSV_OK;
01754 }
01755 
01756 /// @brief     How many headers are there?
01757 /// @return    Count of the headers
01758 int
01759 affx::TsvFile::headersCount()
01760 {
01761   // test here to save a method call.
01762   if (m_headers_vec_packed==false) {
01763     repackHeaders();
01764   }
01765   return (int)m_headers_vec.size();
01766 }
01767 
01768 /// @brief     Is the key a legal key to have in a header?
01769 /// @param     key       the key to check
01770 /// @return    tsv_return_t
01771 int
01772 affx::TsvFile::headerKeyLegal(const std::string& key)
01773 {
01774   // We dont allow '=' in the key
01775   if (key.find('=')!=std::string::npos) {
01776     return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
01777   }
01778   // Nor do we allow headers which start with "header" -- they are reserved
01779   if ((key.size()==(m_headName.length()+1))&&(key.find(m_headName)==0)) {
01780     return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
01781   }
01782   // if not rejected it is ok...
01783   return TSV_OK;
01784 }
01785 
01786 /// @brief     Add a key-value to the headers
01787 /// @param     key       string key
01788 /// @param     val       string value
01789 /// @remarks   sort order defaults to "0"
01790 int
01791 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,const std::string& val)
01792 {
01793   // should a copy be done here?
01794   // might that be the source of the windows problems?
01795   return addHeader(key,val,(int)m_headers_vec.size());
01796 }
01797 
01798 /// @brief     Add a key-value to the headers plus its sort order.
01799 /// @param     key       string key
01800 /// @param     val       string val
01801 /// @param     order     the sort order
01802 /// @return    tsv_error_t
01803 int
01804 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,const std::string& val,int order)
01805 {
01806   int rv;
01807   if ((rv=headerKeyLegal(key))!=TSV_OK) {
01808     return rv;
01809   }
01810   return addHeader_nocheck(key,val,order);
01811 }
01812 
01813 /// @brief     Add a int value as a header
01814 /// @param     key       name of header
01815 /// @param     val       value to set
01816 /// @return
01817 int
01818 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,int val)
01819 {
01820   // cast to a string and add it.
01821   std::ostringstream stream;
01822   stream << val;
01823   addHeader(key,stream.str());
01824   return TSV_OK;
01825 }
01826 
01827 /// @brief     Add a int value as a header
01828 /// @param     key       name of header
01829 /// @param     val       double value to set
01830 /// @return
01831 int
01832 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,double val)
01833 {
01834   // cast to a string and add it.
01835   std::ostringstream stream;
01836   stream << val;
01837   std::string valString = stream.str();
01838   // For Windows, check to see if a three digit exponent with a leading zero is
01839   // being used for double representation.  if so, remove the extra zero (2
01840   // exponent digits conforms to 1999 C standard) 
01841   //e.g. 1.234e003 and 1.234e-003 become 1.234e03 and 1.234e-03
01842   #ifdef WIN32
01843   if (valString.size() >= 5 &&
01844       valString.at(valString.size() - 3) == '0' && 
01845       (valString.at(valString.size() - 4) == 'e' ||
01846        valString.at(valString.size() - 5) == 'e'        
01847        )
01848       ) {
01849     valString.erase(valString.size() - 3, 1);
01850   }
01851   #endif
01852   addHeader(key,valString);
01853   return TSV_OK;
01854 }
01855 
01856 /// @brief     Add a series of headers as key=val1, key=val2, key=valN
01857 /// @param     key       name of header
01858 /// @param     val       vector of values to add.
01859 /// @return    
01860 int
01861 affx::TsvFile::addHeader(const std::string& key,const std::vector<std::string>& val)
01862 {
01863   for (size_t i=0;i<val.size();i++) {
01864     addHeader(key,val[i]);
01865   }
01866   return TSV_OK;
01867 }
01868 
01869 /// @brief     Add a comment to the headers
01870 /// @param     comment   string comment
01871 /// @param     order     sort order
01872 /// @return    tsv_error_t
01873 int
01874 affx::TsvFile::addHeaderComment(const std::string& comment,int order)
01875 {
01876   return addHeader_nocheck("",comment,order);
01877 }
01878 
01879 /// @brief     Add a comment to the headers
01880 /// @param     comment   string comment
01881 /// @return    tsv_error_t
01882 /// @remarks   sort order defaults to order added
01883 int
01884 affx::TsvFile::addHeaderComment(const std::string& comment)
01885 {
01886   return addHeader_nocheck("",comment,(int)m_headers_vec.size());
01887 }
01888 
01889 int
01890 affx::TsvFile::addHeaderComments(const std::vector<std::string>& comments)
01891 {
01892   for (size_t i=0;i<comments.size();i++) {
01893     addHeaderComment(comments[i]);
01894   }
01895   return TSV_OK;
01896 }
01897 
01898 /// @brief     Add a header to the TSV without checking to see if it is legal
01899 /// @param     key       string key
01900 /// @param     val       string val
01901 /// @return    tsv_error_t
01902 int
01903 affx::TsvFile::addHeader_nocheck(const std::string& key,const std::string& val)
01904 {
01905   return addHeader_nocheck(key,val,(int)m_headers_vec.size());
01906 }
01907 
01908 /// @brief     Writes a comment directly to the file.
01909 /// @param     comment
01910 /// @return    tsv_error_t
01911 int
01912 affx::TsvFile::writeFileComment(const std::string& comment)
01913 {
01914   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
01915     TSV_ERR_ABORT("File is not writeable.");
01916   }
01917   m_fileStream << TSV_STRING_COMMENT << comment << m_optEndl;
01918   //
01919   return TSV_OK;
01920 }
01921 
01922 /// @brief     Add a header to the TSV without checking to see if it is legal
01923 /// @param     key       key
01924 /// @param     val       value
01925 /// @param     order     sort order
01926 /// @return    TSV_OK
01927 int
01928 affx::TsvFile::addHeader_nocheck(const std::string& key,const std::string& val,int order)
01929 {
01930   TsvFileHeaderLine* hdrptr=new TsvFileHeaderLine(key,val,order);
01931   //
01932   m_headers_vec.push_back(hdrptr);
01933   m_headers_bykey.insert(make_pair(key,hdrptr));
01934   return TSV_OK;
01935 }
01936 
01937 /// @brief     Add all the headers from another TSV to this one.
01938 /// @param     f_tsv     where to copy the headers from
01939 /// @param     flags     what kind of headers to add (TSV_ADD_COMMENTS,TSV_ADD_KEYS)
01940 /// @return    TSV_OK
01941 int
01942 affx::TsvFile::addHeadersFrom(affx::TsvFile& f_tsv,int flags)
01943 {
01944   return addHeadersFrom(f_tsv,"",flags);
01945 }
01946 
01947 /// @brief     append the headers from another TSV to this one.
01948 /// @param     f_tsv     TSV to copy headers from
01949 /// @param     prefix    string to prefix keys with
01950 /// @param     flags     which kind of headers to add (TSV_ADD_COMMENTS,TSV_ADD_KEYS)
01951 /// @return    tsv_error_t
01952 int
01953 affx::TsvFile::addHeadersFrom(affx::TsvFile& f_tsv,const std::string& prefix,int flags)
01954 {
01955   string key;
01956   string val;
01957 
01958   f_tsv.headersBegin();
01959   while (f_tsv.headersNext(key,val)==TSV_OK) {
01960     if (key=="") {
01961       if ((flags&TSV_ADD_COMMENTS)!=0) {
01962         addHeaderComment(val);
01963       }
01964     } else {
01965       if ((flags&TSV_ADD_KEYS)!=0) {
01966         addHeader(prefix+key,val);
01967       }
01968     }
01969   }
01970   return TSV_OK;
01971 }
01972 
01973 /// @brief     Add headers specified in a vector to this TSV from another TSV
01974 /// @param     f_tsv     source of TSV headers
01975 /// @param     prefix    prefix to add to keys
01976 /// @param     key_vec   vector of keys to add
01977 /// @return    tsv_error_t
01978 int
01979 affx::TsvFile::addHeadersFrom(affx::TsvFile& f_tsv,
01980                               const std::string& prefix,
01981                               std::vector<std::string>& key_vec)
01982 {
01983   string val;
01984 
01985   for (int i=0;i<(int)key_vec.size();i++) {
01986     if (f_tsv.getHeader(key_vec[i],val)==TSV_OK) {
01987       addHeader(prefix+key_vec[i],val);
01988     }
01989   }
01990   return TSV_OK;
01991 }
01992 
01993 /// @brief     Note that the "headerN" lines may not have been generated yet.
01994 /// @return    The number of headers for this file.
01995 int
01996 affx::TsvFile::headerCount()
01997 {
01998   repackHeaders(); // this removes null ptrs so headerCount==size()
01999   return m_headers_vec.size();
02000 }
02001 
02002 /// @brief     Get the value of a header
02003 /// @param     key       which header to get
02004 /// @param     val       string to bind the value to
02005 /// @return    tsv_return_t
02006 int
02007 affx::TsvFile::getHeader(const std::string& key,std::string& val)
02008 {
02009   m_headers_iter=m_headers_bykey.find(key);
02010   if (m_headers_iter==m_headers_bykey.end()) {
02011     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02012   }
02013   val=(*m_headers_iter).second->m_value;
02014   return TSV_OK;
02015 }
02016 
02017 /// @brief     Get the integer value of a header
02018 /// @param     key       key to get
02019 /// @param     val       integer value to be modfied.
02020 /// @return    tsv_error_t
02021 int
02022 affx::TsvFile::getHeader(const std::string& key,int& val)
02023 {
02024   std::string tmp_str;
02025   const char* str_in;
02026   char* str_out;
02027 
02028   if (getHeader(key,tmp_str)==TSV_OK) {
02029     str_in=tmp_str.c_str();
02030     int tmp_val=strtol(str_in,&str_out,0);
02031     if (str_in==str_out) {
02032       return TSV_ERR_FORMAT;
02033     }
02034     val=tmp_val;
02035     return TSV_OK;
02036   }
02037   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02038 }
02039 
02040 /// @brief     Get the integer value of a header
02041 /// @param     key       key to get
02042 /// @param     val       integer value to be modfied.
02043 /// @return    tsv_error_t
02044 int
02045 affx::TsvFile::getHeader(const std::string& key,double& val)
02046 {
02047   std::string tmp_str;
02048   const char* str_in;
02049   char* str_out;
02050 
02051   if (getHeader(key,tmp_str)==TSV_OK) {
02052     str_in=tmp_str.c_str();
02053     double tmp_val=strtod(str_in,&str_out);
02054     if (str_in==str_out) {
02055       return TSV_ERR_FORMAT;
02056     }
02057     val=tmp_val;
02058     return TSV_OK;
02059   }
02060   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02061 }
02062 
02063 /// @brief     Get string values of all headers exactly matching a key
02064 /// @param     key       key to find
02065 /// @param     val       string vector for matching values.
02066 /// @return    tsv_error_t
02067 int
02068 affx::TsvFile::getHeader(const std::string& key,std::vector<std::string>& val)
02069 {
02070   val.clear();
02071   return getHeaderAppend(key,val);
02072 }
02073 
02074 /// @brief     Append string values of all headers exactly matching a key
02075 /// @param     key       key to find
02076 /// @param     val       string vector for appended values.
02077 /// @return    tsv_error_t
02078 int
02079 affx::TsvFile::getHeaderAppend(const std::string& key,std::vector<std::string>& val)
02080 {
02081   int result = TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02082   affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t i;
02083   for (i=m_headers_bykey.find(key);(i!=m_headers_bykey.end())&&(i->first==key);i++) {
02084     val.push_back(i->second->m_value);
02085     result = affx::TSV_OK;
02086   }
02087   return result;
02088 }
02089 
02090 /// @brief     Get string values of all headers containing the substring
02091 /// @param     key       key substring to find
02092 /// @param     val       string vector for matching values.
02093 /// @return    tsv_error_t
02094 int
02095 affx::TsvFile::getHeaderMatchingKeySubstr(const std::string& key,std::vector<std::string>& val)
02096 {
02097   val.clear();
02098   return getHeaderMatchingKeySubstrAppend(key,val);
02099 }
02100 
02101 /// @brief     Append string values of all headers containing the substring
02102 /// @param     key       key substring to find
02103 /// @param     val       string vector for appended values.
02104 /// @return    tsv_error_t
02105 int
02106 affx::TsvFile::getHeaderMatchingKeySubstrAppend(const std::string& key,std::vector<std::string>& val)
02107 {
02108   int result = TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02109   affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t i;
02110   for (i=m_headers_bykey.begin();i!=m_headers_bykey.end();i++) {
02111         if (i->first.find(key)!=string::npos)
02112         {
02113       val.push_back(i->second->m_value);
02114       result = affx::TSV_OK;
02115         }
02116   }
02117   return result;
02118 }
02119 
02120 /// @brief     Does the file have a key==value header which matches
02121 /// @param     key       key to check
02122 /// @param     val       value to check
02123 /// @return    true if there is a matching key==val header
02124 /// @remarks   This is handy to check for matching chip types.
02125 int
02126 affx::TsvFile::hasHeaderEqualTo(const std::string& key,const std::string& val)
02127 {
02128   // printf("hasHeaderEqualTo('%s','%s')\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
02129   // scan the headers.
02130   affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t i;
02131   for (i=m_headers_bykey.find(key);(i!=m_headers_bykey.end())&&(i->first==key);i++) {
02132     // printf("hasHeaderEqualTo: check '%s'/'%s')\n",i->first.c_str(),i->second->m_value.c_str());
02133     if (i->second->m_value==val) {
02134       return TSV_OK;
02135     }
02136   }
02137   // didnt find it.
02138   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02139 }
02140 
02141 void
02142 affx::TsvFile::repackHeaders()
02143 {
02144   if (m_headers_vec_packed==true) {
02145     return;
02146   }
02147 
02148   //
02149   std::vector<affx::TsvFileHeaderLine*> tmp_vec;
02150   std::vector<affx::TsvFileHeaderLine*>::iterator i;
02151 
02152   // save the non-null ones...
02153   for (i=m_headers_vec.begin();i!=m_headers_vec.end();i++) {
02154     if (*i!=NULL) {
02155       tmp_vec.push_back(*i);
02156     }
02157   }
02158   // ...and put them back.
02159   m_headers_vec=tmp_vec;
02160   // we are packed
02161   m_headers_vec_packed=true;
02162 }
02163 
02164 
02165 /// @brief     Sort the headers of this TSV file by (order,key,value)
02166 void
02167 affx::TsvFile::resortHeaders()
02168 {
02169   //
02170   repackHeaders();
02171   // put headers in order
02172   sort(m_headers_vec.begin(),m_headers_vec.end(),affx::header_ptr_less);
02173 }
02174 
02175 /// @brief     Remove the headers named with the key.
02176 /// @param     key the header key value.
02177 /// @return    tsv_error_t
02178 
02179 int
02180 affx::TsvFile::deleteHeaders(const std::string& key)
02181 {
02182   int v_size=(int)m_headers_vec.size();
02183   for (int vi=0;vi<v_size;vi++) {
02184     if ((m_headers_vec[vi]!=NULL) && (m_headers_vec[vi]->m_key==key)) {
02185       deleteHeaderPtr(m_headers_vec[vi]);
02186     }
02187   }
02188   return affx::TSV_OK;
02189 }
02190 
02191 int
02192 affx::TsvFile::deleteHeaders(const std::vector<std::string>& keys)
02193 {
02194   for (size_t i=0;i<keys.size();i++) {
02195     deleteHeaders(keys[i]);
02196   }
02197   return affx::TSV_OK;
02198 }
02199 
02200 int
02201 affx::TsvFile::deleteHeaders(const char**  keys)
02202 {
02203   if (keys!=NULL) {
02204     for (int i=0;keys[i]!=NULL;i++) {
02205       deleteHeaders(keys[i]);
02206     }
02207   }
02208   return affx::TSV_OK;
02209 }
02210 
02211 /// @brief     Remove the header pointed to
02212 /// @param     hdrptr    pointer to the header to delete
02213 /// @return    tsv_error_t
02214 int
02215 affx::TsvFile::deleteHeaderPtr(affx::TsvFileHeaderLine* hdrptr)
02216 {
02217   // skip if done...
02218   if (hdrptr==NULL) {
02219     return TSV_OK;
02220   }
02221 
02222   // find the header ptrs in the map and erase them
02223   affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t mi;
02224   // Goto is an ugly hag to work around win32 stl bug
02225   START_DEL_HEADER_PTR:
02226   for (mi=m_headers_bykey.begin();mi!=m_headers_bykey.end();mi++) {
02227     if (mi->second==hdrptr) {
02228       m_headers_bykey.erase(mi);
02229       goto START_DEL_HEADER_PTR;
02230     }
02231   }
02232   // erase it from the vector, dont resize it.
02233   int find_cnt=0;
02234   int v_size=(int)m_headers_vec.size();
02235   for (int vi=0;vi<v_size;vi++) {
02236     if (m_headers_vec[vi]==hdrptr) {
02237       m_headers_vec[vi]=NULL;
02238       find_cnt++;
02239     }
02240   }
02241   // delete the pointer if it was found in the list.
02242   if (find_cnt>0) {
02243     m_headers_vec_packed=false;
02244     delete hdrptr;
02245     return TSV_OK;
02246   }
02247 
02248   // didnt find it in the list.
02249   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02250 }
02251 
02252 //////////
02253 
02254 /// @brief     Read a classic "v1" header from the top of a file
02255 /// @return    tsv_return_t
02256 /// @remarks   Attempts to guess if this is a tab or comma seperated file
02257 int
02258 affx::TsvFile::f_read_header_v1()
02259 {
02260   int rv;
02261   std::string line;
02262   std::vector<std::string> colname_vec;
02263 
02264   if ((rv=f_getline(line))!=TSV_OK) {
02265     return rv;
02266   }
02267 
02268   // Try and sense what the fieldsep is?
02269   if (m_optAutoSenseSep==true) {
02270     int cnt_fieldsep=countchars(line,m_optFieldSep);
02271     if (cnt_fieldsep==0) {
02272       // whoah We didnt see our fieldsep, take a guess...
02273       int cnt_tabs=countchars(line,TSV_CHAR_TAB);
02274       int cnt_comma=countchars(line,TSV_CHAR_COMMA);
02275       if (cnt_tabs>0) {
02276         m_optFieldSep=TSV_CHAR_TAB;
02277       }
02278       else if (cnt_comma>0) {
02279         m_optFieldSep=TSV_CHAR_COMMA;
02280       }
02281     }
02282   }
02283 
02284   // set the columns
02285   splitstr(line,m_optFieldSep,colname_vec);
02286   for (unsigned int col=0;col<colname_vec.size();col++) {
02287     // discard quotes?
02288     if (m_optAutoDequote==true) {
02289       dequote(colname_vec[col]);
02290     }
02291     //
02292     defineColumn(0,col,colname_vec[col]);
02293   }
02294   return TSV_OK;
02295 }
02296 
02297 /// @brief     Read and parse a v2 header line
02298 int
02299 affx::TsvFile::f_read_header_v2()
02300 {
02301   int rv;
02302   fstream::pos_type f_start;
02303   string line;
02304 
02305   f_start=m_fileStream.tellg();
02306 
02307   if ((rv=f_getline(line))!=TSV_OK) {
02308     return rv;
02309   }
02310 
02311   // printf("header: %s\n",line.c_str());
02312 
02313   ltrim(line);
02314   // "#%" An actual header line
02315   if (line.find("#%")==0) {
02316     string::size_type pos_equal=line.find("=");
02317     if (pos_equal!=string::npos) {
02318       string key(line,2,pos_equal-2);
02319       string val(line,pos_equal+1);
02320       trim(key);
02321       rtrim(val);
02322       // printf("key=%-20s val=%s\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
02323       addHeader_nocheck(key,val);
02324       return TSV_HEADER;
02325     }
02326     // should print a warning.
02327     return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
02328   }
02329   // skip the comment
02330   if (line.find("#")==0) {
02331     addHeaderComment(string(line,1));
02332     return TSV_HEADER;
02333   }
02334 
02335   // not a header line - skip back to start of line to read as data
02336   m_fileStream.seekg(f_start);
02337   return TSV_HEADER_LAST;
02338 }
02339 
02340 /// @brief     Read all the headers and set up the file
02341 /// @return    tsv_return_t
02342 int
02343 affx::TsvFile::f_read_headers()
02344 {
02345   // skip to start of file.
02346   m_fileStream.seekg(0);
02347 
02348   // suck in all the v2 headers
02349   while (f_read_header_v2()==TSV_HEADER) {
02350     // null body
02351   }
02352 
02353   //dump_headers();
02354 
02355   // If we dont have any headers at all, then the first line has the header
02356   // read its header line.
02357   std::string ignored;
02358   if (getHeader(m_headName+"0",ignored)!=TSV_OK) {
02359     if (m_optHasColumnHeader==true) {
02360       m_fileFormat=TSV_FORMAT_V1;
02361       f_read_header_v1();
02362     } else {
02363       m_fileFormat=TSV_FORMAT_TABLE;
02364     }
02365   } else {
02366     m_fileFormat=TSV_FORMAT_V2;
02367     headers_to_fields_v2();
02368   }
02369 
02370   // The rest of the file is data.
02371   m_fileDataPos=m_fileStream.tellg();
02372   // sets line counters
02373   rewind();
02374 
02375   //dump_bindings();
02376   return TSV_OK;
02377 }
02378 
02379 /// @brief     Parse the "headerN" lines
02380 void
02381 affx::TsvFile::headers_to_fields_v2()
02382 {
02383   // now set up mappings
02384   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<9;clvl++) {
02385     string head_name=m_headName;
02386     head_name.append(1,(char)('0'+clvl)); // +"num"
02387     affx::TsvFile::header_iter_t i=m_headers_bykey.find(head_name);
02388     if (i!=m_headers_bykey.end()) {
02389       /// @todo discard the leading spaces and split on whitespace?
02390       vector<string> colname_vec;
02391       splitstr(i->second->m_value,m_optFieldSep,colname_vec);
02392       for (unsigned int col=0;col<colname_vec.size();col++) {
02393         if (col<clvl) {
02394           if (colname_vec[col]!="") {
02395             Verbose::out(1, "==Warning: level=" + ToStr(clvl) + " col=" + ToStr(col) +
02396                          " name=" + colname_vec[col] +" not indended correctly==");
02397 //             printf("==Warning: level=%d col=%d name='%s' not indended correctly\n",
02398 //                    clvl,col,colname_vec[col].c_str());
02399           }
02400         } else {
02401           defineColumn(clvl,col-clvl,colname_vec[col]);
02402         }
02403       }
02404     }
02405   }
02406 }
02407 
02408 //////////
02409 
02410 
02411 /// @brief     Define a column with a
02412 /// @param     clvl
02413 /// @param     cidx
02414 /// @param     cname
02415 /// @param     ctype
02416 /// @return
02417 int affx::TsvFile::defineColumn(int clvl,int cidx,const std::string& cname)
02418 {
02419   return defineColumn(clvl,cidx,cname,TSV_TYPE_UNKNOWN);
02420 }
02421 
02422 /// @brief     record the mapping of column names (cname) to column indexes (cidx).
02423 /// @param     clvl      column level the mapping is for
02424 /// @param     cidx      position the column is at
02425 /// @param     cname     name of the column
02426 /// @remarks   resizes the maps as needed
02427 
02428 
02429 int
02430 affx::TsvFile::defineColumn(int clvl,int cidx,const std::string& cname,tsv_type_t ctype)
02431 {
02432   if (clvl<0) {
02433     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
02434   }
02435   //printf("colname_set(%d,'%s',%d)\n",clvl,cname.c_str(),cidx); //
02436   if (clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size()) {
02437     // plus one as we are going to use 'clvl' as an index...
02438     m_column_map.resize(clvl+1);
02439     m_cnametocidx_map.resize(clvl+1);
02440   }
02441   // expand the width if needed.
02442   if (cidx>=(int)m_column_map[clvl].size()) {
02443     m_column_map[clvl].resize(cidx+1);
02444   }
02445   // record info about this column
02446   m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_clvl=clvl;
02447   m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_cidx=cidx;
02448   m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_cname=cname;
02449   m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_ctype=ctype;
02450   // map column name to column idx
02451   m_cnametocidx_map[clvl][cname]=cidx;
02452 
02453   // default precision if set
02454   if (m_optPrecision>=0) {
02455     m_column_map[clvl][cidx].setPrecision(m_optPrecision);
02456   }
02457 
02458   return (TSV_OK);
02459 }
02460 
02461 /// @brief     Look up the cidx of a column
02462 /// @param     clvl      column level at which to look
02463 /// @param     cname     column name
02464 /// @return    level or less than zero on error
02465 int
02466 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,const std::string& cname,tsv_optionflag_t options)
02467 {
02468   if ((clvl<0)||(clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size())) {
02469     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02470   }
02471   map<string,int>::iterator i;
02472   i=m_cnametocidx_map[clvl].find(cname);
02473   // found it?
02474   if (i!=m_cnametocidx_map[clvl].end()) {
02475     return ((*i).second);
02476   }
02477   // is this a case sensitve match?
02478   if ((options&affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)!=affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE) {
02479     // yes... so fail now.
02480     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02481   }
02482 
02483   // Doing a case-insenstive search is rare, we dont keep an index.
02484   // Rather, we do a linear search across the keys.
02485   std::string cname_lc=affx::tolower(cname);
02486   std::string key_lc;
02487   for (i=m_cnametocidx_map[clvl].begin();i!=m_cnametocidx_map[clvl].end();i++) {
02488     key_lc=affx::tolower((*i).first);
02489     if (key_lc==cname_lc) {
02490       // found a lowercase match...
02491       return ((*i).second);
02492     }
02493   }
02494 
02495   // isnt there as lowercase either.
02496   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02497 }
02498 
02499 // Requres "clvl" and "options" to be defined.
02500 #define CNAME_FIND(_name) { int rv; rv=cname2cidx(clvl,_name,options); if (rv>=0) { return rv; } }
02501 
02502 /// @brief     Find a column index by one of its names.
02503 /// @param     clvl      level
02504 /// @param     alias1    first alias to try
02505 /// @param     alias2    second alias to try
02506 /// @return
02507 int
02508 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,
02509                           const std::string& alias1,
02510                           const std::string& alias2,
02511                           tsv_optionflag_t options)
02512 {
02513   CNAME_FIND(alias1);
02514   CNAME_FIND(alias2);
02515   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02516 }
02517 /// @brief     Find a column index by one of its names.
02518 /// @param     clvl      level
02519 /// @param     alias1    first alias to try
02520 /// @param     alias2    second alias to try
02521 /// @param     alias3    third alias to try
02522 /// @return
02523 int
02524 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,
02525                           const std::string& alias1,
02526                           const std::string& alias2,
02527                           const std::string& alias3,
02528                           tsv_optionflag_t options)
02529 {
02530   CNAME_FIND(alias1);
02531   CNAME_FIND(alias2);
02532   CNAME_FIND(alias3);
02533   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02534 }
02535 /// @brief     Find a column index by one of its names.
02536 /// @param     clvl      level
02537 /// @param     alias1    first  alias to try
02538 /// @param     alias2    second alias to try
02539 /// @param     alias3    third  alias to try
02540 /// @param     alias4    fourth alias to try
02541 /// @return
02542 int
02543 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,
02544                           const std::string& alias1,
02545                           const std::string& alias2,
02546                           const std::string& alias3,
02547                           const std::string& alias4,
02548                           tsv_optionflag_t options)
02549 {
02550   CNAME_FIND(alias1);
02551   CNAME_FIND(alias2);
02552   CNAME_FIND(alias3);
02553   CNAME_FIND(alias4);
02554   return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02555 }
02556 
02557 /// @brief     Covert a column index to a column index
02558 /// @param     clvl      level
02559 /// @param     cidx      index
02560 /// @return    column index
02561 /// @remarks   This exists to make the templates eaiser to write
02562 int
02563 affx::TsvFile::cname2cidx(int clvl,int cidx)
02564 {
02565   if ((clvl<0)||(clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size())) {
02566     return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
02567   }
02568   return cidx;
02569 }
02570 
02571 //////////
02572 
02573 /// @brief     Get a pointer to a column given clvl and cidx
02574 /// @param     clvl     level of column
02575 /// @param     cidx     index of column
02576 /// @return    NULL if not found
02577 TsvFileField*
02578 affx::TsvFile::clvlcidx2colptr(int clvl,int cidx) {
02579   if ((clvl<0)||
02580       (clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size())||
02581       (cidx<0)||
02582       (cidx>=(int)m_column_map[clvl].size())) {
02583     return NULL;
02584   }
02585   return &m_column_map[clvl][cidx];
02586 }
02587 
02588 /// @brief     Return a pointer to the column
02589 /// @param     clvl      level of column
02590 /// @param     cname     name of column
02591 /// @return    NULL if not found
02592 TsvFileField*
02593 affx::TsvFile::clvlcidx2colptr(int clvl,const std::string& cname) {
02594   return clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cname2cidx(clvl,cname));
02595 }
02596 
02597 /// @brief     Get the name of a column by its level and index
02598 /// @param     clvl      column level
02599 /// @param     cidx      column index
02600 /// @param     cname     where to put the name
02601 /// @return    tsv_return_t
02602 int
02603 affx::TsvFile::cidx2cname(int clvl,int cidx,std::string& cname)
02604 {
02605   TsvFileField* colptr=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
02606   if (colptr==NULL) {
02607     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
02608   }
02609   cname=colptr->m_cname;
02610   return TSV_OK;
02611 }
02612 
02613 std::string
02614 affx::TsvFile::getColumnName(int clvl,int cidx)
02615 {
02616   std::string cname;
02617   cidx2cname(clvl,cidx,cname);
02618   return cname;
02619 }
02620 
02621 int
02622 affx::TsvFile::setPrecision(int clvl,int cidx,int places)
02623 {
02624   TsvFileField* colptr=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
02625   if (colptr==NULL) {
02626     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
02627   }
02628   return colptr->setPrecision(places);
02629 }
02630 
02631 int
02632 affx::TsvFile::setPrecision(int clvl,const std::string& cname,int places)
02633 {
02634   return setPrecision(clvl,cname2cidx(clvl,cname),places);
02635 }
02636 
02637 //////////
02638 
02639 /// @brief     open a TSV file
02640 /// @param     fname     name of file to open
02641 /// @return    TSV_OK or an error
02642 int
02643 affx::TsvFile::open(const std::string& fname)
02644 {
02645   int rv;
02646 
02647   close();
02648   
02649   // remeber the name
02650   m_fileName=fname;
02651   //
02652   if (m_fileName.empty()) {
02653     TSV_ERR_ABORT("Cant open an empty filename. (filename='"+m_fileName+"')");
02654   }
02655 
02656   // should we check to see if this file is wacked out?
02657   if (m_optCheckFormatOnOpen) {
02658     if (Fs::isCalvinFile(m_fileName)) {
02659       TSV_ERR_ABORT("This file is a Calvin file. (filename='"+m_fileName+"')");
02660       return TSV_ERR_CALVIN;
02661     }
02662     if (Fs::isHdf5File(m_fileName)) {
02663       TSV_ERR_ABORT("This file is an HDF5 file. (filename='"+m_fileName+"')");
02664       return TSV_ERR_HDF5;
02665     }
02666     // test for binary last, as it is a general test.
02667     // Failing for this text file, commented out for Windows.
02668     // 
02669     //26357     15-Dec-2010 19:09:40    FATAL ERROR:TsvFile.cpp:2664: This file appears to be binary. (filename='../../regression-data/data/idata/translation/regression-data/20080109_31set_DMET3_cn_16various.txt')
02670 #ifndef _WIN32    
02671     if (Fs::isBinaryFile(m_fileName)) {
02672       TSV_ERR_ABORT("This file appears to be binary. (filename='"+m_fileName+"')");
02673       return TSV_ERR_BINARY;
02674     }
02675 #endif
02676     
02677   }
02678   
02679   // clear before opening -- errors are sticky.
02680   m_fileStream.clear();
02681   // hello?!?
02682   Fs::aptOpen(m_fileStream,fname,std::fstream::in|std::fstream::binary);
02683   // Check an error opening the file.
02684   if(!m_fileStream.is_open() || !m_fileStream.good()) {
02685     if (m_optAbortOnError) {
02686       TSV_ERR_ABORT("open: Could not open file: '" + fname + "' to read.");
02687     }
02688     else {
02689       return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02690     }
02691   }
02692 
02693   // now throw an exception if something really bad happens.
02694   m_fileStream.exceptions(ios_base::badbit|ios_base::failbit);
02695 
02696 #ifdef TSV_USE_RDBUF
02697   // This appears to be faster than calling ".get()"
02698   m_rdbuf=m_fileStream.rdbuf();
02699 #endif
02700 
02701   //printf("### opening: '%s' (rdstate=%4d,%s)...\n",
02702   //       m_fileName.c_str(),
02703   //       m_fileStream.rdstate(),
02704   //       (m_fileStream.good()?"good":"not good"));
02705   //file_buf=m_fileStream.rdbuf();
02706   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
02707     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02708   }
02709 
02710   if ( m_rawOpen ) {
02711     return TSV_OK;
02712   }
02713   
02714   // parse the headers
02715   f_read_headers();
02716 
02717   // establish the links
02718   if (m_optLinkVarsOnOpen) {
02719     rv=formatOk();
02720     if (rv!=TSV_OK) {
02721       Verbose::out(1, "TSV: warning: '" + fname + "': bad format (=" + ToStr(rv) + ")");
02722       //    printf("TSV: warning: '%s': bad format (=%d)\n",fname.c_str(),rv);
02723     }
02724   }
02725 
02726   // redudant with above?
02727   linkvars_maybe();
02728 
02729   return TSV_OK;
02730 }
02731 
02732 
02733 /// @brief     Open a table file.  Tables dont have column headers
02734 /// @param     fname
02735 /// @return
02736 int
02737 affx::TsvFile::openTable(const std::string& fname)
02738 {
02739   m_optHasColumnHeader=false;
02740   m_optAutoColumns=true;
02741   //
02742   return open(fname);
02743 }

02746 /// @param     fname
02747 /// @return
02748 int
02749 affx::TsvFile::openCsv(const std::string& fname)
02750 {

02752   m_optAutoDequote=true;
02753   m_optAutoSenseSep=false; // must be ','
02754   m_optEscapeChar='\\';    // The escape char is '\'
02755   m_optEscapeOk=true;
02756   m_optFieldSep=',';       // set the field sep char
02757   m_optHasColumnHeader=true;
02758   //
02759   return open(fname);
