02763 /// @brief     Close the TsvFile
02764 int
02765 affx::TsvFile::close()
02766 {
02767   // close an open stream
02768   if (m_fileStream.is_open()) {
02769     m_fileStream.close();
02770   }
02771   return TSV_OK;
02772 }
02773 
02774 /// @brief Flushs the data to the file.
02775 ///        If you are debugging, you might want to explictly flush the output.
02776 ///        It is not required. Be warned that this slows down the IO.
02777 void
02778 affx::TsvFile::flush()
02779 {
02780   if (m_fileStream.is_open()) {
02781     m_fileStream.flush();
02782   }
02783 }
02784 
02785 /// @brief     Gobble up the tabs without skipping over eol
02786 /// @return    the number of tabs skipped
02787 int
02788 affx::TsvFile::f_advance_tabs()
02789 {
02790   int c;
02791   int tabcnt=0;
02792   int maxtabs=(int)(m_column_map.size()-1);
02793 
02794   m_line_fpos=m_fileStream.tellg();
02795 
02796   // first nibble off expected tabs...
02797   while (tabcnt<maxtabs) {
02798     //c=m_fileStream.get();
02799     c=M_GETC();
02800     // printf("!%c",c);
02801     if (c==TSV_CHAR_TAB) {
02802       tabcnt++;
02803     }
02804     else if (c==TSV_CHAR_COMMENT) {
02805       //m_fileStream.putback((char)c);
02806       if(tabcnt > 0) {
02807         TSV_ERR_ABORT("Error in: '" + m_fileName + "'" +
02808                       " at line " + ToStr(m_lineNum) + ":" +
02809                       " Not allowed to have comment characters except on first character of line.");
02810       }
02811       M_UNGETC(c);
02812       return TSV_LINE_COMMENT;
02813     }
02814     else if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)) {
02815       //m_fileStream.putback((char)c);
02816       M_UNGETC(c);
02817       return (TSV_LINE_BLANK);
02818     }
02819     else {
02820       // m_fileStream.putback((char)c);
02821       M_UNGETC(c);
02822       break;
02823     }
02824   }
02825 
02826   // skip possibly extra whitespace
02827   //c=m_fileStream.peek();
02828   c=M_PEEK();
02829   if (c==TSV_CHAR_COMMENT) {
02830     return (TSV_LINE_COMMENT);
02831   }
02832   if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)||(c==EOF)) {
02833     return (TSV_LINE_BLANK);
02834   }
02835 
02836   if ((c==TSV_CHAR_SPACE)||(c==TSV_CHAR_TAB)) {
02837     std::fstream::pos_type skipstart;
02838     int spaceCnt = -1;
02839     skipstart=m_fileStream.tellg();
02840     //
02841     do {
02842       //c=m_fileStream.get();
02843       c=M_GETC();
02844       spaceCnt++;
02845     } while ((c==TSV_CHAR_SPACE)||(c==TSV_CHAR_TAB));
02846     // what are we looking at now?
02847     if (c==TSV_CHAR_COMMENT) {
02848       //m_fileStream.putback(c);
02849       if(spaceCnt > 0) {
02850         TSV_ERR_ABORT("Error in: " + m_fileName + " at line: " + ToStr(m_lineNum) + "."
02851                       " Not allowed to have comment characters except on first character of line.");
02852       }
02853       M_UNGETC(c);
02854       return (TSV_LINE_COMMENT);
02855     }
02856     if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)||(c==EOF)) {
02857       //m_fileStream.putback(c);
02858       M_UNGETC(c);
02859       return (TSV_LINE_BLANK);
02860     }
02861     // found a normal char, rewind to start of skip
02862     m_fileStream.seekg(skipstart);
02863   }
02864 
02865   return tabcnt;
02866 }
02867 
02868 /// @brief     advance over the end of the line (eol)
02869 /// @return    the number of chars read to get there (not including eol chars)
02870 /// @remarks   The eol chars are not included in the count as there could be 1 or 2
02871 int
02872 affx::TsvFile::f_advance_eol()
02873 {
02874   int charcnt=0;
02875   int c;
02876 
02877   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
02878     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02879   }
02880 
02881   /// @todo this is duplicated from getline but we dont want to accum the data so ok?
02882   while (1) {
02883     // get a char...
02884     // c=m_fileStream.get();
02885     c=M_GETC();
02886     // eof?
02887     //if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
02888     //  break;
02889     //}
02890     if (c==EOF) {
02891       break;
02892     }
02893     // LF ends a line
02894     if (c==TSV_CHAR_LF) {
02895       break;
02896     }
02897     // CR ends a line too.
02898     if (c==TSV_CHAR_CR) {
02899       //c=m_fileStream.peek();
02900       c=M_PEEK();
02901       // CR could be followed by a LF
02902       if (c==TSV_CHAR_LF) {
02903         //c=m_fileStream.get();
02904         c=M_GETC();
02905         break;
02906       }
02907     }
02908     // count the chars
02909     charcnt++;
02910   }
02911 
02912   // we just went forward a line
02913   m_lineNum++;
02914 
02915   //
02916   return charcnt;
02917 }
02918 
02919 
02920 /// @brief     Read data into a column from the file
02921 /// @param     col       column to fill
02922 /// @return    tsv_return_t
02923 /// @remarks   Dont read past the end of the line.
02924 ///            Only use f_advance_eol to do that.
02925 int
02926 affx::TsvFile::f_read_column(TsvFileField* col)
02927 {
02928   int c;
02929   //char* buf_ptr;
02930   //int   buf_len;
02931   int   bi;
02932   char  in_quotes;
02933 
02934   //
02935   assert(col!=NULL);
02936   // mark this column as being null.
02937   col->m_isnull=true;
02938   col->m_value_int_done=false;
02939   col->m_value_double_done=false;
02940   col->m_value_uint_done=false;
02941   col->m_value_ulonglong_done=false;
02942 
02943   // Nothing to be read.
02944   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
02945     col->m_buffer="";
02946     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02947   }
02948 
02949   // Mark it as not being null.
02950   col->m_isnull=false;
02951 
02952   in_quotes=0;
02953 
02954   // The common case is the field is the same size as last time.
02955   // Copy the chars into an already existing string.
02956   bi=0;
02957   col->m_buffer.resize(0);
02958   while (1) {
02959     //c=m_fileStream.get();
02960     c=M_GETC();
02961 
02962     //
02963     if ((m_optEscapeChar==c)&&(m_optEscapeOk==true)) {
02964       //c=m_fileStream.get();
02965       c=M_GETC();
02966       c=unescapeChar(c);
02967     }
02968     // start or end of quotes?
02969     else if (((c==m_optQuoteChar1)&&(m_optQuoteChar1!=0))||
02970              ((c==m_optQuoteChar2)&&(m_optQuoteChar2!=0)))
02971       {
02972         if (in_quotes==0) { // open
02973           in_quotes=c;
02974         }
02975         else if (c==in_quotes) { // close
02976           in_quotes=0;
02977         }
02978       }
02979     else if ((m_optFieldSep==c)&&(in_quotes==0)) {
02980       col->m_buffer.resize(bi); // trunc the buffer to size.
02981       break; // discard the field-sep-char
02982     }
02983     // end of field? (short value)
02984     else if ((c==TSV_CHAR_CR)||(c==TSV_CHAR_LF)) {
02985       //m_fileStream.putback(c); // leave eol char
02986       M_UNGETC(c);
02987       col->m_buffer.resize(bi); // trunc
02988       break;
02989     }
02990     // ran out of data
02991     else if (c==EOF) {
02992       if (bi==0) {
02993         col->m_isnull=true; // revise our opinion about this being non-null
02994       }
02995       col->m_buffer.resize(bi);
02996       return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
02997     }
02998 
02999     // add to our buffer
03000     col->m_buffer.append(1,(char)c); // buffer full, append
03001     bi++;
03002   }
03003 
03004   // dequote the column?
03005   if (col->m_optAutoDequote==true) {
03006     trim(col->m_buffer);
03007     dequote(col->m_buffer);
03008   }
03009 
03010   //printf("z\n"); fflush(NULL);
03011   return TSV_OK;
03012 }
03013 
03014 /// @brief     Read the columns of this level
03015 /// @param     line_clvl column level at which we are reading
03016 /// @return    tsv_return_t
03017 int
03018 affx::TsvFile::f_read_columns(int line_clvl)
03019 {
03020   assert(line_clvl>=0);
03021 
03022   //clearFieldsBelowClvl(line_clvl+1); // profiling
03023 
03024   if (line_clvl<(int)m_column_map.size()) {
03025     unsigned int cidx_size=m_column_map[line_clvl].size();
03026     for (unsigned int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_size;cidx++) {
03027       f_read_column(&m_column_map[line_clvl][cidx]);
03028       m_column_map[line_clvl][cidx].linkedvars_assign(this);
03029       //printf("C:'%s'\n",m_column_map[line_clvl][cidx].buffer.c_str());
03030     }
03031   }
03032 
03033   // Read more columns?
03034   if (m_optAutoColumns) {
03035     //char colname_buf[100];
03036     while (!f_lookingat_eol()) {
03037       int cidx=getColumnCount(line_clvl);
03038       // create a column
03039       std::ostringstream stream;
03040       stream << "col" << cidx;
03041       //snprintf(colname_buf,sizeof(colname_buf),"col%02d",cidx);
03042       defineColumn(line_clvl,cidx,stream.str());
03043       //
03044       f_read_column(&m_column_map[line_clvl][cidx]);
03045     }
03046   }
03047 
03048   // skip past the end of this line...
03049   f_advance_eol();
03050 
03051   return TSV_OK;
03052 }
03053 
03054 std::fstream::pos_type affx::TsvFile::line_fpos()
03055 {
03056   return m_line_fpos; ///< Where the current line starts
03057 }
03058 
03059 //////////
03060 
03061 /// @brief     Allocate a new binding object
03062 /// @return    pointer to the allocated binding var
03063 TsvFileBinding*
03064 affx::TsvFile::linkvar_alloc()
03065 {
03066   TsvFileBinding* var=new TsvFileBinding();
03067   m_linkvars_vec.push_back(var);
03068   m_linkvars_done=false;
03069   return var;
03070 }
03071 
03072 /// @brief     clear all the linkages from columns to vars
03073 void
03074 affx::TsvFile::linkvars_clear()
03075 {
03076   //
03077   m_linkvars_done=false;
03078   m_linkvars_errors=0;
03079   m_linkvars_warnings=0;
03080   //
03081   unsigned int m_column_map_size=m_column_map.size();
03082   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_column_map_size;clvl++) {
03083     unsigned int m_column_map_clvl_size=m_column_map[clvl].size();
03084     for (unsigned int cidx=0;cidx<m_column_map_clvl_size;cidx++) {
03085       m_column_map[clvl][cidx].linkedvars_clear();
03086     }
03087   }
03088 }
03089 
03090 void
03091 affx::TsvFile::linkvars_free()
03092 {
03093   linkvars_clear();
03094   for (size_t i=0;i<m_linkvars_vec.size();i++) {
03095     delete m_linkvars_vec[i];
03096     m_linkvars_vec[i]=NULL;
03097   }
03098   m_linkvars_vec.clear();
03099 }
03100   
03101 /// @brief     Link a binding to a column
03102 /// @param     clvl      where to link to
03103 /// @param     cidx      where to link to
03104 /// @param     var       the var to link
03105 void
03106 affx::TsvFile::linkvar_column(int clvl,int cidx,TsvFileBinding* var)
03107 {
03108   var->islinked=false;
03109   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
03110 
03111   if (col==NULL) {
03112     // out of bounds
03113     m_linkvars_errors++;
03114     return;
03115   }
03116   // found the column, copy over info
03117   col->linkedvar_push(var);
03118   var->islinked=true;
03119 }
03120 
03121 /// @brief     Link a binding var to a column
03122 /// @param     var       var to link
03123 void
03124 affx::TsvFile::linkvar_link(TsvFileBinding* var)
03125 {
03126   assert(var!=NULL);
03127 
03128   //printf("link=%p errs=%d\n",var,m_linkvars_errors);
03129   if (var->m_bindto_type==TSV_BINDTO_NONE) {
03130     // dead
03131   }
03132   else if (var->m_bindto_type==TSV_BINDTO_CIDX) { // by index
03133     linkvar_column(var->m_bindto_clvl,var->m_bindto_cidx,var);
03134   }
03135   else if (var->m_bindto_type==TSV_BINDTO_CNAME) { // by name
03136     int cidx=cname2cidx(var->m_bindto_clvl,var->m_bindto_cname);
03137     if (cidx>=0) {
03138       linkvar_column(var->m_bindto_clvl,cidx,var);
03139     }
03140   } else {
03141     TSV_ERR_ABORT("linkvar_link: internal error: m_bindto_type="+ToStr(var->m_bindto_type));
03142   }
03143 
03144   // check the binding condition...
03145   if (var->islinked==true) {   // no need to check
03146     return;
03147   }
03148   if ((var->m_flags&TSV_BIND_REQUIRED)!=0) {
03149     m_linkvars_errors++;
03150     if (m_optAbortOnError) {
03151       TSV_ERR_ABORT("Required column: '"+ToStr(var->m_bindto_cname)+"' not found in file: '"+m_fileName+"'.");
03152     }
03153     return;
03154   }
03155   if ((var->m_flags&TSV_BIND_WARNING)!=0) {
03156     m_linkvars_warnings++;
03157     return;
03158   }
03159 }
03160 
03161 /// @brief     Examine the list of bindings and establish the linkages
03162 /// @return    number of unlinked bindings
03163 int
03164 affx::TsvFile::linkvars_makelinks()
03165 {
03166   // zap the current linkages
03167   linkvars_clear();
03168   // walk the vars and link them all
03169   unsigned int m_linkvars_vec_size=m_linkvars_vec.size();
03170   for (unsigned int vi=0;vi<m_linkvars_vec_size;vi++) {
03171     linkvar_link(m_linkvars_vec[vi]);
03172   }
03173   //
03174   m_linkvars_done=true;
03175   return m_linkvars_errors;
03176 }
03177 
03178 /// @brief     Dont do anything if the linkages are done, otherwise link
03179 /// @return    same as linkvars_makelinks
03180 int
03181 affx::TsvFile::linkvars_maybe()
03182 {
03183   if (m_linkvars_done) {
03184     return m_linkvars_errors;
03185   }
03186   if (!(m_fileStream.is_open())) {
03187     return 0;
03188   }
03189   return linkvars_makelinks();
03190 }
03191 
03192 /// @brief     The number of binding errors. (vars which couldnt be linked)
03193 /// @return    same as linkvars_makelinks
03194 int
03195 affx::TsvFile::bindErrorCnt()
03196 {
03197   // make sure the links are in place.
03198   linkvars_maybe();
03199   // report the number of links we couldnt make
03200   return m_linkvars_errors;
03201 }
03202 
03203 /// @brief     Is the format of the file ok
03204 /// @return    tsv_return_t
03205 int
03206 affx::TsvFile::formatOk()
03207 {
03208   if (bindErrorCnt()==0) {
03209     return TSV_OK;
03210   }
03211   // print the errors
03212   printBindingErrors();
03213 
03214   return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
03215 }
03216 
03217 /// @brief     print messages about unbound variables.
03218 void
03219 affx::TsvFile::printBindingErrors()
03220 {
03221   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_linkvars_vec.size();i++) {
03222     if (!m_linkvars_vec[i]->islinked) { // oh no!
03223       if ((m_linkvars_vec[i]->m_flags&(TSV_BIND_WARNING|TSV_BIND_REQUIRED))!=0) {
03224         Verbose::out(2, "TSV: warning: did not bind ('" +
03225                      ToStr(m_linkvars_vec[i]->m_bindto_clvl) + "," +
03226                      ToStr(m_linkvars_vec[i]->m_bindto_cidx) + ",'" +
03227                      m_linkvars_vec[i]->m_bindto_cname +"')");
03228       }
03229     }
03230   }
03231 }
03232 
03233 /// @brief     Remove all the bindings.
03234 void
03235 affx::TsvFile::unbindAll()
03236 {
03237   clearBindings();
03238 }
03239 
03240 //////////
03241 
03242 /// macro to define code
03243 #define TSV_BIND_FUNC(Xtype,Xfield) \
03244 int \
03245 affx::TsvFile::bind(int clvl,int cidx,Xtype* ptr,tsv_bindopt_t flags,int interncache_size) \
03246 { \
03247   TsvFileBinding* var=linkvar_alloc(); \
03248   var->m_bindto_type=TSV_BINDTO_CIDX; \
03249   var->m_bindto_clvl=clvl; \
03250   var->m_bindto_cidx=cidx; \
03251   var->m_flags=flags; \
03252   var->m_interncache_size=interncache_size; \
03253   var->Xfield=ptr; \
03254 \
03255   linkvars_maybe(); \
03256 \
03257   return TSV_OK; \
03258 } \
03259 int \
03260 affx::TsvFile::bind(int clvl,const std::string& cname,Xtype* ptr,tsv_bindopt_t flags,int interncache_size) \
03261 { \
03262   TsvFileBinding* var=linkvar_alloc(); \
03263   var->m_bindto_type=TSV_BINDTO_CNAME; \
03264   var->m_bindto_clvl=clvl; \
03265   var->m_bindto_cname=cname; \
03266   var->m_flags=flags; \
03267   var->m_interncache_size=interncache_size; \
03268   var->Xfield=ptr; \
03269 \
03270   linkvars_maybe(); \
03271 \
03272   return TSV_OK; \
03273 }
03274 
03275 // Expand the above
03276 TSV_BIND_FUNC(std::string,m_ptr_string);
03277 TSV_BIND_FUNC(int,m_ptr_int);
03278 TSV_BIND_FUNC(double,m_ptr_double);
03279 TSV_BIND_FUNC(float,m_ptr_float);
03280 TSV_BIND_FUNC(unsigned int,m_ptr_uint);
03281 TSV_BIND_FUNC(uint64_t,m_ptr_ulonglong);
03282 
03283 // dont need this any more.
03284 #undef TSV_BIND_FUNC
03285 
03286 //////////
03287 
03288 /// @brief     Rewind back to the start of the data and clear the fields
03289 /// @return    tsv_return_t
03290 int
03291 affx::TsvFile::rewind()
03292 {
03293   clearFields();
03294   m_fileStream.clear();
03295   m_fileStream.seekg(m_fileDataPos);
03296   //
03297   m_lineLvl=0;
03298   m_lineNum=0;
03299   m_eof=false;
03300   //
03301   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
03302     m_eof=true;
03303     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
03304   }
03305   return TSV_OK;
03306 }
03307 
03308 /// @brief     advance to the next line and bind the values
03309 /// @return    tsv_return_t
03310 int
03311 affx::TsvFile::nextLine()
03312 {
03313   // insure the vars are inplace
03314   // we do this after the bind calls
03315   // linkvars_maybe();
03316 
03317   // some sort of error or eof?
03318   //if ((!m_fileStream.good())||(m_fileStream.peek()==EOF)) {
03319   if ((!m_fileStream.good())||(M_PEEK()==EOF)) {
03320     m_eof=true;
03321     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
03322   }
03323 
03324   // insure the vars are inplace
03325   //linkvars_maybe();
03326 
03327   // count the tabs to figure out what level it is at
03328   m_lineLvl=f_advance_tabs();
03329   if (m_lineLvl<0) {
03330     f_advance_eol();
03331     return TSV_OK;
03332   }
03333 
03334   // Read the data into the columns
03335   return f_read_columns(m_lineLvl);
03336 }
03337 
03338 /// @brief     Skip to the next level of data which matches seek_clvl
03339 /// @param     seek_clvl   the level to skip to
03340 /// @return    tsv_return_t
03341 /// @remarks   nextLevel will skip over lines which are more indented than
03342 ///            seek_clvl, but will not skip over lines less indented.
03343 int
03344 affx::TsvFile::nextLevel(int seek_clvl)
03345 {
03346   char c = '\0';
03347   // insure the vars are inplace
03348   // linkvars_maybe();
03349 
03350   // Read lines until we find a line of the correct level.
03351   while (1) {
03352     if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
03353       clearFields();
03354       m_eof=true;
03355       return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
03356     }
03357     c = M_PEEK();
03358     // speed tweak to avoid uncessary seek. Unless this is the 0 level
03359     // the first character should be a tab. This handles a common case
03360     // in pgf files.
03361     if(seek_clvl != 0 && c != TSV_CHAR_TAB && c != TSV_CHAR_COMMENT) {
03362       return TSV_LEVEL_LAST;
03363     }
03364     else if (c == EOF) {
03365       clearFields();
03366       return TSV_ERR_EOF;
03367     }
03368 
03369     // what level is this line at?
03370     m_lineLvl=f_advance_tabs();
03371 
03372     // skip the line if it isnt a data line.
03373     if (m_lineLvl<0) {
03374       f_advance_eol();
03375       continue;
03376     }
03377 
03378     // a match; bind and return
03379     if (m_lineLvl==seek_clvl) {
03380       return f_read_columns(m_lineLvl);
03381     }
03382     // a master; dont skip it
03383     if (m_lineLvl<seek_clvl) {
03384       m_fileStream.seekg(m_line_fpos);
03385       return TSV_LEVEL_LAST;
03386     }
03387     // a child; skip it
03388     if (m_lineLvl>seek_clvl) {
03389       f_advance_eol();
03390     }
03391   }
03392   return (TSV_ERR_UNKNOWN);
03393 }
03394 
03395 //////////
03396 
03397 
03398 
03399 /// @brief     Read a couple of lines of the TsvFile and figure out the types.
03400 /// @return
03401 int
03402 affx::TsvFile::deduce_types()
03403 {
03404   std::vector<int> clvl_seen;
03405   int clvl_seen_cnt;
03406   int clvl_max;
03407   int clvl;
03408   int cidx_max;
03409   int cidx;
03410   int seen_all_levels=0;
03411 
03412   // start from the beginning.
03413   rewind();
03414 
03415   //
03416   clvl_seen.resize(getLevelCount(),0);
03417   clvl_seen_cnt=0;
03418   clvl_max=getLevelCount();
03419 
03420   while (nextLine()==affx::TSV_OK) {
03421     clvl=lineLevel();
03422     // skip if we have done this level already...
03423     if (clvl_seen[clvl]==1) {
03424       continue;
03425     }
03426     // mark being seen.
03427     clvl_seen[clvl]=1;
03428     clvl_seen_cnt++;
03429 
03430     // scan the columns
03431     cidx_max=getColumnCount(clvl);
03432     for (cidx=0;cidx<cidx_max;cidx++) {
03433       // set type from value
03434       int tmp_int;
03435       double tmp_double;
03436       std::string tmp_string;
03437       if (get(clvl,cidx,tmp_int)==affx::TSV_OK) {
03438         set_type(clvl,cidx,affx::TSV_TYPE_INT);
03439       }
03440       else if (get(clvl,cidx,tmp_double)==affx::TSV_OK) {
03441         set_type(clvl,cidx,affx::TSV_TYPE_DOUBLE);
03442       }
03443       else if (get(clvl,cidx,tmp_string)==affx::TSV_OK) {
03444         set_type(clvl,cidx,affx::TSV_TYPE_STRING);
03445       }
03446       else {
03447         set_type(clvl,cidx,affx::TSV_TYPE_UNKNOWN);
03448       }
03449     }
03450       // all levels seen?
03451     if (clvl_seen_cnt==clvl_max) {
03452       seen_all_levels=1;
03453       break;
03454     }
03455   }
03456 
03457   // rewind and return
03458   rewind();
03459   //
03460   return ((seen_all_levels==1)?affx::TSV_OK:affx::TSV_ERR_UNKNOWN);
03461 }
03462 
03463 int
03464 affx::TsvFile::clear_max_sizes()
03465 {
03466   // reset the sizes
03467   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_column_map.size();++clvl) {
03468     for (unsigned int cidx=0;cidx<m_column_map[clvl].size();cidx++) {
03469       m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_max_size=0;
03470     }
03471   }
03472   return affx::TSV_OK;
03473 }
03474 
03475 int
03476 affx::TsvFile::deduce_sizes()
03477 {
03478   clear_max_sizes();
03479 
03480   // start from the beginning.
03481   rewind();
03482 
03483   TsvFileField* col;
03484   unsigned int clvl;
03485   //
03486   while (nextLine()==affx::TSV_OK) {
03487     clvl=lineLevel();
03488     // scan the columns
03489     int cidx_max=getColumnCount(clvl);
03490     for (int cidx=0;cidx<cidx_max;cidx++) {
03491       col=&m_column_map[clvl][cidx];
03492       int col_cur_size=col->m_buffer.size();
03493       if (col_cur_size>col->m_max_size) {
03494         col->m_max_size=col_cur_size;
03495       }
03496     }
03497   }
03498 
03499   // rewind and return
03500   rewind();
03501   return affx::TSV_OK;
03502 }
03503 
03504 /// @brief     Return the declared type of this column
03505 /// @param     clvl
03506 /// @param     cname
03507 /// @return
03508 affx::tsv_type_t
03509 affx::TsvFile::get_type(int clvl,const std::string& cname)
03510 {
03511   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cname);
03512   if (col==NULL) {
03513     return (TSV_TYPE_ERR);
03514   }
03515   return col->get_type();
03516 }

03527     return (TSV_TYPE_ERR);

03564   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx); \
03565   if ((col==NULL)||(col->isNull())) { \
03566     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND); \
03567   } \
03568   return col->get(&val);

03576 affx::TsvFile::get(int clvl,int cidx,std::string& val)
03577 {
03578   TSV_GET_VALUE_CIDX();

03725 #define TSV_GET_VEC_BODY()                       \
03726   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);  \
03727   if ((col==NULL)||(col->isNull())) {            \
03728     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);                   \
03729   }                                              \
03730   return col->get(vec,sep)
03731 
03732 #define TSV_GET_VEC_FUNC(TYPE)                  \
03733   int                                                                 \
03734   affx::TsvFile::get(int clvl,int cidx,std::vector<TYPE>* vec,char sep) \
03735   {                                                                     \
03736     TSV_GET_VEC_BODY();                                                 \
03737   }                                                                     \
03738   int                                                                   \
03739   affx::TsvFile::get(int clvl,const std::string& cidx,std::vector<TYPE>* vec,char sep) \
03740   {                                                                     \
03741     TSV_GET_VEC_BODY();                                                 \
03742   }
03743 
03744 TSV_GET_VEC_FUNC(std::string);
03745 TSV_GET_VEC_FUNC(int);
03746 TSV_GET_VEC_FUNC(float);
03747 TSV_GET_VEC_FUNC(double);
03748 
03749 #undef TSV_GET_VEC_BODY
03750 #undef TSV_GET_VEC_FUNC

03755 #define TSV_SET_VALUE_BODY()                    \
03756   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx); \
03757   if (col==NULL) {                              \
03758     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);                  \
03759   }                                             \
03760   return col->set(val);
03761

03763   int                                           \
03764   affx::TsvFile::set(int clvl,int cidx,TYPE val)  \
03765   {                                               \
03766     TSV_SET_VALUE_BODY();                         \
03767   }                                               \
03768   int                                                                   \
03769   affx::TsvFile::set(int clvl,const std::string& cidx,TYPE val) \
03770   {                                                                     \
03771     TSV_SET_VALUE_BODY();                                               \
03772   }
03773

03776 TSV_SET_VALUE_FUNC(int)

03779 TSV_SET_VALUE_FUNC(double)

03799   }                                                                     \

03802   {                                                                     \
03803     TSV_SET_VEC_BODY()                                                  \
03804   }
03805 
03806 // define them.

03817 /// @brief     Is the field set?
03818 /// @param     clvl      The column level level of field
03819 /// @param     cidx      The column index (0-based) of the field
03820 /// @return    false if set, otherwise true
03821 bool
03822 affx::TsvFile::isNull(int clvl,int cidx)
03823 {
03824   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
03825   if (col==NULL) {
03826     return true;
03827   }
03828   return col->isNull();
03829 }
03830 /// @brief     Is the field set?
03831 /// @param     clvl      The column level level of field
03832 /// @param     cname     The column index (0-based) of the field
03833 /// @return    false if set, otherwise true
03834 bool
03835 affx::TsvFile::isNull(int clvl,const std::string& cname)
03836 {
03837   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cname);
03838   if (col==NULL) {
03839     return true;
03840   }
03841   return col->isNull();
03842 }
03843 
03844 /// @brief     Is the field empty (null or no value)?
03845 /// @param     clvl      The column level level of field
03846 /// @param     cidx      The column index (0-based) of the field
03847 /// @return    false if set, otherwise true
03848 bool
03849 affx::TsvFile::isEmpty(int clvl,int cidx)
03850 {
03851   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cidx);
03852   if (col==NULL) {
03853     return true;
03854   }
03855   return col->isEmpty();
03856 }
03857 /// @brief     Is the field set?
03858 /// @param     clvl      The column level level of field
03859 /// @param     cname     The column index (0-based) of the field
03860 /// @return    false if set, otherwise true
03861 bool
03862 affx::TsvFile::isEmpty(int clvl,const std::string& cname)
03863 {
03864   TsvFileField* col=clvlcidx2colptr(clvl,cname);
03865   if (col==NULL) {
03866     return true;
03867   }
03868   return col->isEmpty();
03869 }

03871 ////////////////////
03872 
03873 /// @brief     Dump the meta-information of the tsvfile
03874 /// @remark    Used for debugging
03875 void
03876 affx::TsvFile::dump()
03877 {
03878   //
03879   printf("TsvDump====================\n");
03880   printf("== tsv: filename='%s'\n",m_fileName.c_str());
03881   dump_headers();
03882   dump_bindings();
03883   printf("====================\n");
03884 }
03885 
03886 /// @brief     Dump the header values of the tsvfile
03887 /// @remark    Used for debugging
03888 void
03889 affx::TsvFile::dump_headers()
03890 {
03891   printf("=== headers:\n");
03892   affx::TsvFile::header_t* h_ptr;
03893   for (int hi=0;hi<(int)m_headers_vec.size();hi++) {
03894     h_ptr=m_headers_vec[hi];
03895     printf("==header: ");
03896     if (h_ptr==NULL) {
03897       printf("NULL\n");
03898       continue;
03899     }
03900     if (h_ptr->m_key=="") {
03901       printf("%2d:#%s\n",h_ptr->m_order,h_ptr->m_value.c_str());
03902     } else {
03903       printf("%2d:#%%%s=%s\n",h_ptr->m_order,h_ptr->m_key.c_str(),h_ptr->m_value.c_str());
03904     }
03905   }
03906 
03907   //
03908   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_column_map.size();++clvl) {
03909     for (unsigned int col=0;col<m_column_map[clvl].size();col++) {
03910       printf("==map: %3d: %3d : %s\n",clvl,col,m_column_map[clvl][col].m_cname.c_str());
03911     }
03912   }
03913 }
03914 
03915 /// @brief     Dump the bindings of the tsvfile
03916 /// @remark    Used for debugging
03917 void
03918 affx::TsvFile::dump_bindings()
03919 {
03920   printf("==bindings:\n");
03921 
03922   for (unsigned int vi=0;vi<m_linkvars_vec.size();vi++) {
03923     TsvFileBinding* var=m_linkvars_vec[vi];
03924     printf("%3d : %p : bound to clvl=%2d cidx=%2d cname='%s')\n",
03925            vi,var,
03926            var->m_bindto_clvl,var->m_bindto_cidx,var->m_bindto_cname.c_str());
03927   }
03928 }
03929 
03930 /// @brief     Dump the data of the tsvfile
03931 /// @remark    Used for debugging
03932 void
03933 affx::TsvFile::dump_data()
03934 {
03935   string tmpstr;
03936 
03937   while (nextLine()==TSV_OK) {
03938     int clvl=lineLevel();
03939     printf("%02d :",clvl);
03940     for (int cidx=0;cidx<getColumnCount(clvl);cidx++) {
03941       if (cidx!=0) {
03942         //printf("%c",m_optFieldSep);
03943         printf("|");
03944       }
03945       get(clvl,cidx,tmpstr);
03946       printf("%d='%s'",cidx,tmpstr.c_str());
03947     }
03948     printf("\n");
03949   }
03950   printf("== Read %6d lines\n",m_lineNum);
03951 }
03952 
03953 
03954 /// @brief     Dump the indexes
03955 /// @remark    Used for debugging
03956 void
03957 affx::TsvFile::dump_indexes()
03958 {
03959   printf("indexes ------------------------------\n");
03960   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_index_vec.size();i++) {
03961     TsvFileIndex* idx=m_index_vec[i];
03962     if (idx!=NULL) {
03963       idx->dump();
03964     }
03965   }
03966 }

03968 ////////////////////
03969 
03970 /// @brief     Allocate a TsvFileIndex
03971 /// @return    pointer to the new index
03972 TsvFileIndex*
03973 affx::TsvFile::index_alloc()
03974 {
03975   TsvFileIndex* idx=new TsvFileIndex;
03976   m_index_vec.push_back(idx);
03977   // we will need to index
03978   m_index_done=false;
03979   return idx;
03980 }
03981 
03982 /// @brief     Creates an index object
03983 /// @param     clvl      column level
03984 /// @param     cname     column name
03985 /// @param     kind      TSV_INDEX_STRING or TSV_INDEX_INT
03986 /// @param     flags     unused at the moment
03987 /// @return    TSV_OK
03988 /// @remark    The indexing is not done until it is actually needed
03989 int
03990 affx::TsvFile::defineIndex(int clvl,const std::string& cname,int kind,int flags)
03991 {
03992   TsvFileIndex* idx=index_alloc();
03993   idx->m_bindto_type=TSV_BINDTO_CNAME;
03994   idx->m_bindto_clvl=clvl;
03995   idx->m_bindto_cname=cname;
03996   //
03997   assert(kind!=0);
03998   idx->m_kind=kind;
03999   idx->m_flags=flags;
04000   //
04001   return TSV_OK;
04002 }
04003 
04004 /// @brief     Creates an index object
04005 /// @param     clvl      column level
04006 /// @param     cidx      column
04007 /// @param     kind
04008 /// @param     flags
04009 /// @return
04010 int
04011 affx::TsvFile::defineIndex(int clvl,int cidx,int kind,int flags)
04012 {
04013   TsvFileIndex* idx=index_alloc();
04014   idx->m_bindto_type=TSV_BINDTO_CIDX;
04015   idx->m_bindto_clvl=clvl;
04016   idx->m_bindto_cidx=cidx;
04017   //
04018   assert(kind!=0);
04019   idx->m_kind=kind;
04020   idx->m_flags=flags;
04021   //
04022   return TSV_OK;
04023 }
04024 
04025 /// @brief     Seek to the start of a line but dont read it.
04026 /// @param     line      line to seek to
04027 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04028 int
04029 affx::TsvFile::seekLine(linenum_t line)
04030 {
04031   //
04032   indexBuildMaybe();
04033   // off the end?
04034   if (line>m_index_linefpos.size()) {
04035     assert(0);
04036     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
04037   }
04038   m_fileStream.clear();
04039   m_fileStream.seekg(m_index_linefpos[line]);
04040   // we seeked to this line, but did not read it.
04041   m_lineNum=line;
04042   //
04043   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
04044     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
04045   }
04046   return TSV_OK;
04047 }
04048 
04049 /// @brief     goto a line reading the parent lines and then the line itself
04050 /// @param     line
04051 /// @return tsv_return_t
04052 /// @remarks When we goto a line, we need to goto the parents first
04053 ///          to set the parent values. This presents a "read consistent"
04054 ///          view of the data.
04055 int
04056 affx::TsvFile::gotoLine(linenum_t line)
04057 {
04058   vector<linenum_t>::iterator lb;
04059   linenum_t sline;
04060 
04061   // do some bookkeeping first
04062   clearFields();
04063   indexBuildMaybe();
04064   //printf("gotoLine(%d)===\n",line);
04065 
04066   if (line>=m_index_linefpos.size()) {
04067     int maxLine = (int)m_index_linefpos.size();
04068     if (m_optAbortOnError) {
04069       TSV_ERR_ABORT("Cant goto line " + ToStr(line) + " of " + ToStr(maxLine));
04070     }
04071     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
04072   }
04073 
04074   // Goto each parent lines first
04075   // This will bind the parent values so the view of the data is consistent
04076   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_index_lineclvl.size();clvl++) {
04077     lb=lower_bound(m_index_lineclvl[clvl].begin(),m_index_lineclvl[clvl].end(),line);
04078     // Is this a parent line?
04079     if ((lb==m_index_lineclvl[clvl].end())||(*lb>line)) {
04080       sline=*(lb-1);
04081     } else {
04082       sline=*lb;
04083     }
04084     // move and parse
04085     //printf("%2d : seek(%d)\n",clvl,sline);
04086     seekLine(sline);
04087     nextLine();
04088     // done?
04089     if (sline==line) {
04090       break;
04091     }
04092   }
04093 
04094   return TSV_OK;
04095 }
04096 
04097 int affx::TsvFile::countTotalDataLines()
04098 {
04099   int line_cnt=0;
04100 
04101   // start at the beginning.
04102   rewind();
04103   // count them up.
04104   while (nextLine()==affx::TSV_OK) {
04105     // data line levels are >=0
04106     if (lineLevel()>=0) {
04107       line_cnt++;
04108     }
04109   }
04110   // back to the beginning so we leave the file at a known state.
04111   rewind();
04112 
04113   return line_cnt;
04114 }
04115   
04116 
04117 void affx::TsvFile::currentLineAsString(std::string& line)
04118 {
04119   for (int t=0;t<m_lineLvl;t++) {
04120     line.append("\t");
04121   }
04122   //
04123   for (size_t c_idx=0;c_idx<m_column_map[m_lineLvl].size();c_idx++) {
04124     if (c_idx!=0) {
04125       line.append("\t");
04126     }
04127     line.append(m_column_map[m_lineLvl][c_idx].m_buffer);
04128   }
04129   line.append("\n");
04130 }
04131 
04132 /// @brief     build the indexes for a file
04133 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04134 int
04135 affx::TsvFile::indexBuild()
04136 {
04137   std::fstream::pos_type excursion_fpos;
04138   TsvFileIndex* idx;
04139 
04140   //
04141   m_index_done=false;
04142 
04143   // force building the line index  // DEBUGGING
04144   //option_lineindex=true;
04145   // neednt bother building the indexes.
04146   //if ((option_lineindex==false)&&(m_index_vec.size()==0)) {
04147   //return TSV_OK;
04148   //}
04149 
04150   // clear out the line mappings
04151   m_index_linefpos.clear();
04152   m_index_lineclvl.resize(m_column_map.size());
04153   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_index_lineclvl.size();clvl++) {
04154     m_index_lineclvl[clvl].clear();
04155   }
04156 
04157   // clear out the indexes.
04158   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_index_vec.size();i++) {
04159     idx=m_index_vec[i];
04160     if (idx!=NULL) {
04161       idx->clear();
04162       // pre-compute the cidxes of the indexes which are by name
04163       if (idx->m_bindto_type==TSV_BINDTO_CNAME) {
04164         idx->m_bindto_cidx=cname2cidx(idx->m_bindto_clvl,idx->m_bindto_cname);
04165       }
04166     }
04167   }
04168 
04169   // remember where we are before we rewind
04170   excursion_fpos=m_fileStream.tellg();
04171   rewind();
04172 
04173   unsigned int m_index_vec_size=m_index_vec.size();
04174 
04175   int l_num;
04176   while (nextLine()==TSV_OK) {
04177     l_num=m_lineNum-1; // because nextLine went past it.
04178     // line->fpos
04179     m_index_linefpos.push_back(m_line_fpos);
04180     // if m_lineLvl is <0, then it was a comment or blank line
04181     // and there no need to do the rest
04182     //printf("L1: %4d : %4d : %u\n",l_num,m_lineLvl,(unsigned int)m_line_fpos);
04183     if (m_lineLvl<0) {
04184       // skip this line
04185       continue;
04186     }
04187     // parent-child lines
04188     m_index_lineclvl[m_lineLvl].push_back(l_num);
04189     //std::string key;
04190     //std::string val;
04191     //get(0,0,key);
04192     //get(0,1,val);
04193     //printf("L2: K:'%s' V:'%s'\n",key.c_str(),val.c_str());
04194 
04195     //
04196     for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_index_vec_size;i++) {
04197       TsvFileIndex* idx=m_index_vec[i];
04198       if ((idx!=NULL)&&
04199           (idx->m_bindto_clvl==m_lineLvl)&&
04200           (idx->m_bindto_cidx>=0)) {
04201         idx->data_add(&m_column_map[m_lineLvl][idx->m_bindto_cidx],l_num);
04202       }
04203     }
04204   }
04205 
04206   //
04207   m_fileStream.clear();
04208   m_fileStream.seekg(excursion_fpos);
04209 
04210   // mark the indexes as done
04211   m_index_done=true;
04212   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_index_vec_size;i++) {
04213     TsvFileIndex* idx=m_index_vec[i];
04214     if (idx!=NULL) {
04215       idx->m_done=true;
04216     }
04217   }
04218 
04219   return TSV_OK;
04220 }
04221 
04222 /// @brief     build the indexes if needed
04223 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04224 int
04225 affx::TsvFile::indexBuildMaybe()
04226 {
04227   if (m_index_done) {
04228     return TSV_OK;
04229   }
04230   return indexBuild();
04231 }
04232 
04233 /// @brief     Find an index which matches what we need
04234 /// @param     clvl   clvl
04235 /// @param     cidx   cidx
04236 /// @param     kind   What is being matched?
04237 /// @return    NULL if no index found
04238 TsvFileIndex*
04239 affx::TsvFile::index_matching(int clvl,int cidx,int kind)
04240 {
04241   TsvFileIndex* idx;
04242 
04243   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_index_vec.size();i++) {
04244     idx=m_index_vec[i];
04245     if ((idx!=NULL)&&
04246         (idx->m_bindto_clvl==clvl)&&
04247         (idx->m_bindto_cidx==cidx)&&
04248         (idx->m_kind==kind)) {
04249       return idx;
04250     }
04251   }
04252   return NULL;
04253 }
04254 
04255 /// @brief     Do we have a index on this column for strings?
04256 /// @param     clvl   clvl
04257 /// @param     cidx   cidx
04258 /// @param     val    a dummy value for typedness
04259 /// @return    NULL or a pointer to the index
04260 TsvFileIndex*
04261 affx::TsvFile::index_matching_1(int clvl,int cidx,std::string& val)
04262 {
04263   return index_matching(clvl,cidx,TSV_INDEX_STRING);
04264 }
04265 /// @brief     Do we have a index on this column for ints?
04266 /// @param     clvl   clvl
04267 /// @param     cidx   cidx
04268 /// @param     val    a dummy value for typedness
04269 /// @return    NULL or a pointer to the index
04270 TsvFileIndex*
04271 affx::TsvFile::index_matching_1(int clvl,int cidx,int val)
04272 {
04273   return index_matching(clvl,cidx,TSV_INDEX_INT);
04274 }
04275 /// @brief     Do we have a index on this column for doubles?
04276 /// @param     clvl   clvl
04277 /// @param     cidx   cidx
04278 /// @param     val    a dummy value for typedness
04279 /// @return    NULL or a pointer to the index
04280 TsvFileIndex*
04281 affx::TsvFile::index_matching_1(int clvl,int cidx,double val)
04282 {
04283   return index_matching(clvl,cidx,TSV_INDEX_DOUBLE);
04284 }
04285 /// @brief     Do we have a index on this column for unsigned ints?
04286 /// @param     clvl   clvl
04287 /// @param     cidx   cidx
04288 /// @param     val    a dummy value for typedness
04289 /// @return    NULL or a pointer to the index
04290 TsvFileIndex*
04291 affx::TsvFile::index_matching_1(int clvl,int cidx,unsigned int val)
04292 {
04293   return index_matching(clvl,cidx,TSV_INDEX_UINT);
04294 }
04295 /// @brief     Do we have a index on this column for uint64_t?
04296 /// @param     clvl   clvl
04297 /// @param     cidx   cidx
04298 /// @param     val    a dummy value for typedness
04299 /// @return    NULL or a pointer to the index
04300 TsvFileIndex*
04301 affx::TsvFile::index_matching_1(int clvl,int cidx,uint64_t val)
04302 {
04303   return index_matching(clvl,cidx,TSV_INDEX_ULONGLONG);
04304 }
04305 
04306 /// @brief     Clear the results of the last findBegin
04307 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04308 int
04309 affx::TsvFile::findResultsClear()
04310 {
04311   m_findresults_pos=0;
04312   m_findresults.clear();
04313   return TSV_OK;
04314 }
04315 
04316 /// @brief     Handy template
04317 /// @param     clvl   column level
04318 /// @param     cidx   column index
04319 /// @param     op     the kind of comparison to do (tsv_op_t)
04320 /// @param     val    value to search for
04321 /// @param     flags  how to order the results (tsv_orderby_t)
04322 /// @return    tsv_error_t
04323 template<typename T1,typename T2>
04324 int
04325 affx::TsvFile::findBegin_tmpl(int clvl,T1 cidx,int op,T2 val,int flags)
04326 {
04327   // discard the old
04328   findResultsClear();
04329 
04330   // gotta be there
04331   int cidx_int=cname2cidx(clvl,cidx);
04332   if ((clvl<0)||(cidx_int<0)) {
04333     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
04334   }
04335 
04336   //
04337   indexBuildMaybe();
04338 
04339   // which index to use?
04340   TsvFileIndex* idx=index_matching_1(clvl,cidx_int,val);
04341   if (idx==NULL) {
04342     /// @todo if (m_optAutoIndex==true){index_column
04343     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
04344   }
04345 
04346   //
04347   //if (idx->done==false) {
04348   //indexBuild();
04349   //}
04350 
04351   //
04352   idx->results_append(m_findresults,op,val);
04353 
04354   // should we sort by line position?
04355   if ((flags&TSV_ORDERBY_LINE)!=0) {
04356     sort(m_findresults.begin(),m_findresults.end());
04357   }
04358 
04359   // dont go to the first result -- findNext will do the movement.
04360   return TSV_OK;
04361 }
04362 
04363 ///! Crank out the different types we want to expose to the programmer
04364 #define TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(Xtype1,Xtype2) \
04365 int \
04366 affx::TsvFile::findBegin(int clvl,Xtype1 cidx,int op,Xtype2 val,int flags)  \
04367 { \
04368   return findBegin_tmpl(clvl,cidx,op,val,flags);    \
04369 }
04370 
04371 //! Big list of allowed types.
04372 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(int        ,std::string);
04373 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(std::string,std::string);
04374 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(int        ,int);
04375 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(std::string,int);
04376 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(int        ,double);
04377 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(std::string,double);
04378 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(int        ,unsigned int);
04379 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(std::string,unsigned int);
04380 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(int        ,uint64_t);
04381 TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN(std::string,uint64_t);
04382 
04383 #undef TSV_DEFUN_FIND_BEGIN
04384 
04385 //////////
04386 
04387 /// @brief     Return the count of found lines.
04388 /// @return    The number of matching lines to the last findBegin.
04389 unsigned int
04390 affx::TsvFile::findResultsCount()
04391 {
04392   return (int)m_findresults.size();
04393 }
04394 
04395 /// @brief     Goto the next result
04396 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04397 int
04398 affx::TsvFile::findNext()
04399 {
04400   if (m_findresults_pos>=m_findresults.size()) {
04401     return TSV_FIND_LAST;
04402   }
04403   return gotoLine(m_findresults[m_findresults_pos++]);
04404 }
04405 
04406 
04407 //////////
04408 
04409 /// @brief     Define a TSV file from a string of field names
04410 /// @param     definition
04411 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04412 int
04413 affx::TsvFile::defineFile(const std::string& definition)
04414 {
04415   // clear out the old state
04416   clear();
04417   // and define the new...
04418   return defineFileParse(definition);
04419 }
04420 
04421 /// @brief     Overlay the definition on top of the current file.
04422 /// @param     definition
04423 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04424 /// @remarks defineFile uses "\n" to seperate levels, "\t" to seperate columns
04425 ///          and "," to add options to the field name.
04426 ///          at the moment there arent any options.
04427 int
04428 affx::TsvFile::defineFileParse(const std::string& definition)
04429 {
04430   std::vector<std::string> split_line;
04431   std::vector<std::string> split_col;
04432   std::vector<std::string> split_coldef;
04433 
04434   splitstr(definition,'\n',split_line);
04435   for (unsigned int li=0;li<split_line.size();li++) {
04436     if (split_line[li]!="") {
04437       splitstr(split_line[li],'\t',split_col);
04438       for (unsigned int ci=0;ci<split_col.size();ci++) {
04439         // name,options
04440         splitstr(split_col[ci],',',split_coldef);
04441         //
04442         defineColumn(li,ci,split_coldef[0]);
04443       }
04444     }
04445   }
04446   return TSV_OK;
04447 }
04448 
04449 //////////
04450 
04451 /// @brief     Write a number of Field seperators to the file
04452 /// @param     cnt
04453 void
04454 affx::TsvFile::writeFieldSep(int cnt)
04455 {
04456   for (int i=0;i<cnt;i++) {
04457     m_fileStream << m_optFieldSep;
04458   }
04459 }
04460 
04461 /// @brief     Write a string to the output stream, quoting if needed
04462 /// @param     str
04463 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04464 int
04465 affx::TsvFile::write_str(const std::string& str)
04466 {
04467   if (m_optDoQuote==true) {
04468     m_fileStream<<m_optQuoteChar<<str<<m_optQuoteChar;
04469   } else {
04470     m_fileStream<<str;
04471   }
04472   return TSV_OK;
04473 }
04474 
04475 /// @brief     Write the keyval headers to the file
04476 void
04477 affx::TsvFile::writeKeyValHeaders()
04478 {
04479   int h_size;
04480   int h_i;
04481   affx::TsvFile::header_t* h_ptr;
04482 
04483   // want to write them in order.
04484   resortHeaders();
04485 
04486   h_size=(int)m_headers_vec.size();
04487   for (h_i=0;h_i<h_size;h_i++) {
04488     h_ptr=m_headers_vec[h_i];
04489     if (h_ptr==NULL) {
04490       continue;
04491     }
04492     // Dont output bad headers which got stuck in with "addHeader_nocheck"
04493     /// @todo Maybe output them all anyways?
04494     // a comment?
04495     if (h_ptr->m_key=="") {
04496       m_fileStream << TSV_STRING_COMMENT << h_ptr->m_value << m_optEndl;
04497     }
04498     // key=value
04499     else if (headerKeyLegal(h_ptr->m_key)==TSV_OK) {
04500       m_fileStream << TSV_STRING_META << h_ptr->m_key << "=" << h_ptr->m_value << m_optEndl;
04501     }
04502   }
04503 }
04504 
04505 /// @brief     Write the headers for a given level
04506 /// @param     clvl
04507 void
04508 affx::TsvFile::writeColumnHeaders_clvl(int clvl)
04509 {
04510   if ((0<=clvl)&&(clvl<m_column_map.size())) {
04511     size_t cidx_size=m_column_map[clvl].size();
04512     size_t cidx_size_1=cidx_size-1;
04513     for (size_t cidx=0;cidx<cidx_size;cidx++) {
04514       write_str(m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_cname);
04515       if (cidx<cidx_size_1) {
04516         m_fileStream << m_optFieldSep;
04517       }
04518     }
04519   }
04520   m_fileStream << m_optEndl;
04521 }
04522 
04523 /// @brief     Write the "headerN" lines which define the Columns
04524 void
04525 affx::TsvFile::writeColumnHeaders()
04526 {
04527   for (unsigned int clvl=0;clvl<m_column_map.size();clvl++) {
04528     m_fileStream << "#%" << m_headName << clvl << "=";
04529     writeFieldSep(clvl);
04530     writeColumnHeaders_clvl(clvl);
04531   }
04532 }
04533 
04534 /// @brief     Write the file headers
04535 void
04536 affx::TsvFile::writeHeaders()
04537 {
04538   writeKeyValHeaders();
04539   writeColumnHeaders();
04540 }
04541 
04542 /// @brief     open the stream for writing
04543 /// @param     filename
04544 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04545 tsv_return_t
04546 affx::TsvFile::writeOpen(const std::string& filename)
04547 {
04548   // finish off the old stream
04549   close();
04550   // clear the error conditions before trying the open
04551   m_fileStream.clear();
04552   // start
04553   m_fileName=filename;
04554 
04555   Fs::aptOpen(m_fileStream, filename,std::ios::out|std::ios::binary);
04556   // throw if something really bad happens.
04557   m_fileStream.exceptions(ios_base::badbit|ios_base::failbit);
04558   //
04559   if ((!m_fileStream.is_open())||(!m_fileStream.good())) {
04560     if (m_optAbortOnError) {
04561       TSV_ERR_ABORT("writeOpen(): Couldn't open file '" + filename + "' to write.");
04562     }
04563     //    printf("open of '%s' failed!\n",filename.c_str());
04564     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
04565   }
04566   return TSV_OK;
04567 }
04568 
04569 /// @brief     Set the options up for "tsv" format and write the tsv-v1 header
04570 /// @param     filename
04571 /// @return
04572 tsv_return_t
04573 affx::TsvFile::writeTsv_v1(const std::string& filename)
04574 {
04575   // this file format only supports one level.
04576   if (getLevelCount()>1) {
04577     return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
04578   }
04579 
04580   // set the personality
04581   m_optFieldSep='\t';
04582   m_optDoQuote=false;
04583   m_optQuoteChar='"';
04584 
04585   //
04586   tsv_return_t rv;
04587   if ((rv=writeOpen(filename))!=TSV_OK) {
04588     return rv;
04589   }
04590 
04591   writeKeyValHeaders();
04592   if (getLevelCount()==1) {
04593     writeColumnHeaders_clvl(0);
04594   }
04595 
04596   flush();
04597   return TSV_OK;
04598 }
04599 
04600 /// @brief     Open the file and write the headers
04601 /// @param     filename  filename to open
04602 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04603 /// @remarks   Once open, set the values with "tsv->set(lvl,col,val)" and
04604 ///            write them with "tsv->writeLevel(lvl)".
04605 ///            If you want to define your own format, you can cobble it up from:
04606 ///            writeOpen, setting the options, and the writeHeaders().
04607 tsv_return_t
04608 affx::TsvFile::writeTsv_v2(const std::string& filename)
04609 {
04610   tsv_return_t rv;
04611   if ((rv=writeOpen(filename))!=TSV_OK) {
04612     return rv;
04613   }
04614 
04615   writeHeaders();
04616 
04617   flush();
04618   return TSV_OK;
04619 }
04620 
04621 
04622 /// @brief     open the file for writing in "v2" format.
04623 /// @param     filename
04624 /// @return    tsv_error_t
04625 tsv_return_t
04626 affx::TsvFile::writeTsv(const std::string& filename)
04627 {
04628   // use v2 ("#%headerN=") when required
04629   if (getLevelCount()>0) {
04630     return writeTsv_v2(filename);
04631   }
04632   // otherwise v1
04633   else {
04634     return writeTsv_v1(filename);
04635   }
04636 }
04637 
04638 /// @brief     Set the options up for "csv" format and write the CSV header
04639 /// @param     filename
04640 /// @return
04641 tsv_return_t
04642 affx::TsvFile::writeCsv(const std::string& filename)
04643 {
04644   // this file format only supports one level.
04645   if (getLevelCount()!=1) {
04646     return (TSV_ERR_FORMAT);
04647   }
04648 
04649   // set the personality
04650   m_optFieldSep=',';
04651   m_optDoQuote=true;
04652   m_optQuoteChar='"';
04653 
04654   //
04655   tsv_return_t rv;
04656   if ((rv=writeOpen(filename))!=TSV_OK) {
04657     return rv;
04658   }
04659 
04660   //
04661   writeKeyValHeaders();
04662   writeColumnHeaders_clvl(0);
04663 
04664   //
04665   flush();
04666   return TSV_OK;
04667 }
04668 
04669 /// @brief     Write a level of data to the file.
04670 /// @param     clvl      The level to write
04671 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04672 int
04673 affx::TsvFile::writeLevel(int clvl)
04674 {
04675   if ((clvl<0)||(clvl>=(int)m_column_map.size())) {
04676     // no levels to be written.
04677     assert(0);
04678     return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
04679   }
04680 
04681   // indent for the current level
04682   writeFieldSep(clvl);
04683 
04684   size_t cidx_size=(int)m_column_map[clvl].size();
04685   size_t cidx_size_1=cidx_size-1;
04686   int last_precision=-1;
04687 
04688   for (size_t cidx=0;cidx<cidx_size;cidx++) {
04689     TsvFileField* col=&m_column_map[clvl][cidx];
04690     //
04691     if (m_optDoQuote==true) {
04692       m_fileStream<<m_optQuoteChar;
04693     }
04694     // pick an output method based on the the current format of the value.
04695     // the ifs are ordered by frequency.
04696     if (col->m_val_state==affx::VALSTATE_STRING) {
04697       if ((m_optEscapeOk==true)&&(m_optEscapeChar!=0)) {
04698         m_fileStream << escapeString(col->m_buffer,m_optEscapeChar);
04699       }
04700       else {
04701         m_fileStream << col->m_buffer;
04702       }
04703     }
04704     else if (col->m_val_state==affx::VALSTATE_DOUBLE) {
04705       // change in precision?  Avoid doing this each time around.
04706       if (last_precision!=col->m_precision) {
04707         m_fileStream.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
04708         m_fileStream.precision(col->m_precision);
04709         last_precision=col->m_precision;
04710       }
04711       m_fileStream << col->m_value_double;
04712     }
04713     else if (col->m_val_state==affx::VALSTATE_INT) {
04714       m_fileStream << col->m_value_int;
04715     }
04716     else {
04717       TSV_ERR_ABORT("writeLevel(): internal error. m_val_state="+ToStr(col->m_val_state));
04718     }
04719     //
04720     if (m_optDoQuote==true) {
04721       m_fileStream<<m_optQuoteChar;
04722     }
04723     //
04724     if (cidx<cidx_size_1) {
04725       m_fileStream << m_optFieldSep;
04726     }
04727   }
04728   m_fileStream << m_optEndl;
04729 
04730   //
04731   if (!m_fileStream.good()) {
04732     TSV_ERR_ABORT("writeLevel(): bad filestream.");
04733     return (TSV_ERR_FILEIO);
04734   }
04735 
04736   return TSV_OK;
04737 }
04738 
04739 /// @brief     Copy the "format" of the file
04740 /// @param     f_tsv     the tsv to copy from
04741 void
04742 affx::TsvFile::copyFormat(affx::TsvFile& f_tsv)
04743 {
04744   clear();
04745   //
04746   for (int clvl=0;clvl<f_tsv.getLevelCount();clvl++) {
04747     for (int cidx=0;cidx<f_tsv.getColumnCount(clvl);cidx++) {
04748       std::string cname;
04749       f_tsv.cidx2cname(clvl,cidx,cname);
04750       defineColumn(clvl,cidx,cname);
04751     }
04752   }
04753 }
04754 
04755 /// @brief     copy the fields from one tsv to another tsv
04756 /// @param     f_tsv
04757 /// @param     clvl      level at which to copy
04758 /// @return    tsv_return_t
04759 int
04760 affx::TsvFile::copyLevel(affx::TsvFile& f_tsv,int clvl)
04761 {
04762   if ((clvl<getLevelCount())&&(clvl<f_tsv.getLevelCount())) {
04763     for (int cidx=0;cidx<f_tsv.getColumnCount(clvl);cidx++) {
04764       set(clvl,cidx,f_tsv.m_column_map[clvl][cidx].m_buffer);
04765     }
04766     return TSV_OK;
04767   }
04768   return (TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND);
04769 }
04770 
04771 int
04772 affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec(const std::string& fileName,
04773                                const std::string& colName,
04774                                std::vector<std::string>* vec,
04775                                int optEscapeOk)
04776 {
04777   affx::TsvFile tsv;
04778   int col_idx;
04779   std::string tmp_str;
04780 
04781   vec->clear();
04782 
04783   if (tsv.open(fileName)!=TSV_OK) {
04784     TSV_ERR_ABORT("extractColToVec: Cant open: '" +fileName+"'");
04785   }
04786   if (optEscapeOk==0) {
04787     tsv.m_optEscapeOk=false;
04788   }
04789 
04790   col_idx=tsv.cname2cidx(0,colName);
04791   if (col_idx<0) {
04792     TSV_ERR_ABORT("extractColToVec: column '"+colName+"' not found in file '"+fileName+"'");
04793   }
04794 
04795   while(tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK) {
04796     if (tsv.get(0,col_idx,tmp_str)!=TSV_OK) {
04797       TSV_ERR_ABORT("extractColToVec: Problem reading '"+colName+"' from '"+fileName+"'");
04798     }
04799     vec->push_back(tmp_str);
04800   }
04801   tsv.close();
04802   //
04803   return TSV_OK;
04804 }
04805 
04806 int
04807 affx::TsvFile::extractColToVec(const std::string& fileName,
04808                                const std::string& colName,
04809                                std::vector<std::string>* vec)
04810 {
04811   int optEscapeOk=1;
04812 #ifdef WIN32
04813   optEscapeOk=0;
04814 #endif
04815   return extractColToVec(fileName,colName,vec,optEscapeOk);
04816 }

04821 affx::TsvFile::setPrecision(int p)
04822 {
04823   m_optPrecision=p;
04824   return TSV_OK;
04825 }

04827 //////////
04828 
04829 int
04830 affx::TsvFile::printDuplicateHeaders()
04831 {
04832   header_iter_t iter,iter_last;
04833   int dup_cnt=0;
04834 
04835   iter=m_headers_bykey.begin();
04836   // skip non key=val headers
04837   while ((iter!=m_headers_bykey.end())&&(iter->second->m_key=="")) {
04838     iter++;
04839   }
04840   if (iter==m_headers_bykey.end()) {
04841     return 0;
04842   }
04843   // walk the keys in order looking for dups
04844   while (1) {
04845     iter_last=iter;
04846     iter++;
04847     // done?
04848     if (iter==m_headers_bykey.end()) {
04849       break;
04850     }
04851     // a dup?
04852     if (iter->second->m_key==iter_last->second->m_key) {
04853       // print all the dup headers
04854       iter_last->second->print();
04855       dup_cnt++;
04856       while (iter->second->m_key==iter_last->second->m_key) {
04857         iter->second->print();
04858         dup_cnt++;
04859         iter++;
04860       }
04861     }
04862   }
04863   //
04864   return dup_cnt;
04865 }
04866 
04867 //
04868 affx::tsv_type_t TsvFile::stringToColType(const std::string& str)
04869 {
04870   if (str=="string") {
04871     return TSV_TYPE_STRING;
04872   }
04873   if (str=="int") {
04874     return TSV_TYPE_INT;
04875   }
04876   if (str=="float") {
04877     return TSV_TYPE_FLOAT;
04878   }
04879   if (str=="double") {
04880     return TSV_TYPE_DOUBLE;
04881   }
04882   // it is an error if we couldnt convert the string.
04883   return TSV_TYPE_ERR;
04884 }

04886 
04887 /// @brief     Count the number of total lines, assuming a text file. 
04888 /// @param     filename     name of file to open
04889 /// @return    Line count. TSV_ERR_FILEIO, TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND on error.
04890 
04891 int TsvFile::getLineCountInFile(const std::string& filename, bool abortOnError)
04892 {
04893 
04894   if ( filename.empty() || !Fs::fileExists(filename) ) {
04895     if (abortOnError) {
04896       TSV_ERR_ABORT("affx::TsvFile::getLineCountInFile: file not found: '" + filename + "'.");
04897     }
04898     else {
04899       return 0;
04900     }
04901   }
04902 
04903   std::ifstream fstream;
04904   Fs::aptOpen(fstream, filename, std::ios_base::binary);
04905   
04906   // Check an error opening the file.
04907   if(!fstream.is_open() || !fstream.good()) {
04908     if (abortOnError) {
04909       TSV_ERR_ABORT("affx::TsvFile::getLineCountInFile: Could not open file: '" + filename + "' to read.");
04910     }
04911     else {
04912       return 0;
04913     }
04914   }
04915   
04916   int count = TSV_ERR_FILEIO;
04917 
04918   try {
04919     count = std::count(std::istreambuf_iterator<char>(fstream), std::istreambuf_iterator<char>(), '\n');
04920     fstream.seekg(-1, std::ios_base::end);
04921     char last = NULL;
04922     fstream.get(last);
04923     if ( last != '\n' ) {
04924       count++;
04925     }
04926   }
04927   catch (exception e) {
04928     if ( abortOnError) {
04929       TSV_ERR_ABORT(std::string("affx::TsvFile::getLineCountInFile: read error '")+strerror(errno)+"'.");
04930     }
04931     else {
04932       fstream.close();
04933       return 0;
04934     }
04935   }
04936   fstream.close();
04937   return count;
04938   
04939 }
04940 
04941 /// @brief     Replace a character in a file with another. 
04942 /// @param     filename name of file for replacement
04943 /// @param     a source character
04944 /// @param     b replacement character
04945 /// @return    TSV_OK or (TSV_ERR_FILEIO, TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) on error.
04946 int TsvFile::replaceCharInFile(const std::string& filename, char a, char b, bool abortOnError )
04947 {
04948 
04949   tsv_return_t rv = TSV_OK;
04950 
04951   if ( filename.empty() || !Fs::fileExists(filename) ) {
04952     if (abortOnError) {
04953       TSV_ERR_ABORT("affx::TsvFile::replace: file not found: '" + filename + "'.");
04954     }
04955     else {
04956       return TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND;
04957     }
04958   }
04959 
04960 
04961   std::string tmp_name = filename + "~";
04962   
04963   // Aborts if permission denied
04964   if ( Fs::touch(tmp_name, abortOnError)  != APT_OK ) {
04965     return TSV_ERR_FILEIO;
04966   }
04967 
04968   try {
04969     std::ifstream in_file(filename.c_str());
04970     std::ofstream out_file(tmp_name.c_str());
04971     std::istreambuf_iterator<char> in(in_file);
04972     std::istreambuf_iterator<char> eos;
04973     std::ostreambuf_iterator<char> out(out_file);
04974     std::replace_copy(in, eos, out, a, b);
04975   }
04976   catch (exception e) {
04977     if ( abortOnError) {
04978       TSV_ERR_ABORT(std::string("affx::TsvFile::replace: error '")+strerror(errno)+"'.");
04979     }
04980     else {
04981       rv = TSV_ERR_FILEIO;
04982     }
04983   }
04984     
04985   if ( Fs::rm(filename, false) == APT_OK ) {
04986     if ( !Fs::fileRename(tmp_name, filename, false )) {
04987       rv = TSV_ERR_FILEIO;
04988     }
04989   }
04990   else{
04991     Fs::rm(tmp_name, false);
04992     rv = TSV_ERR_FILEIO;
04993   }
04994   
04995   return rv;
04996   
04997 }
